Una de ellas es Dominga, quien hace venta de comidas en su casa, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que a sus clientes les gusta mucho las comidas que hace, así poco a poco está creciendo y también comenta que gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe le va mejor. 
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de las comidas carne, pan para hamburguesas, entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Virgen del Carmen is in its second cycle with the communal bank, besides being part of the elimination of poverty program, working to improve their living conditions.

One of them is Dominga, who sells food in her house.  She says that it is going very well for her, because her customers really like the food she makes, and so little by little her business is growing.  She also comments that thanks to the training she receives, things are going better for her.

Dominga is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients needed to prepare the food: meat, and hamburger buns, among others. This will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy meat and buns for hamburgers, among other things.

loans.name: Marie Conception

texts.fr: Marie Conception est une jeune femme de 44 ans célibataire et mère de cinq enfants dont l'âge vari entre 19 et 3 ans. parmi ses enfants, deux vont encore à l'école. Marie est une commerçante dans un marché de la capital depuis sept années et détient un comptoir sur lequel elle commercialise des vivres frais et secs( tomates, pommes de terre, légume, arachide, etc.)Son activité se déroule bien, mais elle est très souvent confrontée aux problèmes de rupture de stocks de marchandises. Elle désire ardemment agrandir son activité pour pouvoir répondre dans les délais aux attentes de sa clientèle qui va grandissante de jour en jour. D'où la nécessité pour elle d'obtenir ce crédit. Les bénéfices qui en résulteront seront d'une part réinvestis dans l'activité et l'autre partie lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie Conception is a 44-year old woman, who is single and mother to five children, whose ages range from three to 19 years old. Two of her children still go to school. Marie has been a trader in one of the capital's markets for the past seven years and has a stall on which she sells fresh and dried food (tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables, groundnut, etc.). Her business is going well, but she often faces the problem of a shortage of stock. She would really like to expand her business in order to respond on a timely basis to the demands of her ever-increasing customer base. It is for this reason she is getting a loan. The profits she makes as a result of the loan will be partly reinvested in the business and partly to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy goods (fresh and dried food).

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Dashtavan village of Ararat region. He lives with his mother, father and sister.

Artur has been providing dental technician services to locals for three years. Due to his tireless and hard work, Artur has a lot of clients from the region. Now, in order to be able to purchase tools that he needs for his work, Artur has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Because of family's poor conditions Artur isn't able to save money to invest in the dental service, so the loan is very important for him.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed to provide dental services.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the region of Kampala North in Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Francis has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells groceries of different kinds. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods to sell, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams and onions.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the region of Mubende in Uganda. He is married and has three children; one is currently in school. For the past two years, Moses has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and shoes, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and serve the increased demand. 

Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger, well-stocked shop. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Cyrille

texts.fr: Cyrille est un homme âgé de 32 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant de 10 ans. Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 5 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Cyrille is a 32-year old man, who is a bachelor and father to a 10-year old child. He opened a grocery store in one of the capital's districts, which he has been managing for five years now. His small business works well thanks to the warm welcome he gives to his customers, his experience in this field and the customer base which he has built up over the years. The latter is becoming so significant now that he cannot meet customer demand because his capital is too small and he is obliged to buy his products on a retail basis. He is requesting this loan to increase his capital and diversify the goods he buys and sells (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy,...) so that he can increase his profit margin. He will reinvest part of his profit in his business to cover its needs, and the remainder will allow him to provide for his daily needs as well as those of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of basic products.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Fred, is a father of six with a wife. He is an agriculturalist, who rears mainly cows, a skill he gained from his father who was a predominant cattle-keeper.

He sells some of the cows that are no longer strong enough to give birth as well as the young bulls. 

He is applying for a loan so that he will buy good cows and later sell the old and ill-looking ones in his stock. He is hard-working and resilient. He is excited about the partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is from Vanadzor town, where he lives with his wife and son. 

For over 45 years, Gagik has been earning his living by providing different types of construction services to locals. He works hard to be able to gather enough income and cover the family's basic needs. Gagik receives many orders from people due to his attentive and high quality work. Realizing the importance of the income that he gets from the construction business, Gagik wants to enlarge it. 

He has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase the tools that are needed for construction work, and be able to increase the quality of the work he does.

Gagik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This loan will greatly help Gagik, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools for providing construction services

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a Kiva borrower; she describes herself as innovative. 

She operates a retail business, where she sells books, printing papers, and other stationery. 

She will use the Kes 13,440 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house; this will benefit five people. 

She hopes that in the future she will become a wholesaler of stationery.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: La Fortuna Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Fortuna” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras que quieren dar a sus familias todo lo no pudieron tener. Son de una zona rural, aun en crecimiento, luchando por mejorar y crecer.
Sulema es una de las integrantes, quien tiene una pequeña peluquería, y por medio de su negocio está dando un excelente servicio a sus clientes y su comunidad entera, es una persona muy trabajadora, que sueña con poder mejorar su negocio y poder dar trabajo a las demás personas que como ella quieren crecer.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues tintes, enjuagues y demás, y así seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “La Fortuna” committee was formed when several residents of the city of Santaní got together. She are enterprising women who are fighters that want to give their families everything they weren't able to have. They are from a rural area that is still growing, fighting to grow and improve.   

Sulema is one of the members. She has a small hair salon and with her business is giving her customers and the whole community an excellent service. She is a very hardworking person who dreams of being able to improve her business and give work to other people who want to grow like she does. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying shampoo, color conditioners, conditioners and more so that she can continue to work and give her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, color conditioners, conditioners and more.

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señoras. Gladys  está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Feria Libre, vive por la parroquia de Sidcay en Cuenca, lugar que goza de paisajes que nos brindan su geografía accidentada, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas solidarias que aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora. Gladys tiene 52 años de edad, está divorciada y ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros uno trabaja y la otra está estudiando en el colegio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Gladys labora en los quehaceres de su hogar y desde hace 3 años se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, los que vende en pie y por libras y poco a poco va obteniendo clientela. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos para la venta. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is taking out her second loan with her friends and companions from the Feria Libre group. She lives in the Sidcay parish in Cuenca, a place with hilly landscapes. Its people work raising animals, farming, and as merchants. They are supportive people who still maintain their culture and traditions. 

Gladys is 52 years old. She is divorced and has 4 grown children. Two of them are married and live on their own. Of her two single children, one works and the other is in high school. They don't own their own home and are renters. Gladys does housework and for the last three years has worked buying and selling chickens. She sells them live or by the pound. little by little she has gained customers.  

The money from the loan will be invested in buying chickens to sell. Her goal is to grow more in the business.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Kusemererwa

texts.en:
Kusemererwa is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende District of Uganda. He is married with four children, three of them in school. For the past three years, Kusemererwa has been working hard to manage his salon, where he does hairdressing. 

To help expand his business, Kusemererwa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair-cutting machines and mirrors. This investment will help Kusemererwa generate greater profits and offer better services to people.

Kusemererwa hopes that in the future, he will be able to enlarge his salon. 

Note: Kusemererwa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kusemererwa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair-cutting machines and mirrors

loans.name: Shabnum

texts.en:
Shabnum is a 34-year-old, married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community and makes enough through business to contribute to the family income. 

Shabnum requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de Santaní, una zona bastante alejada de la zona céntrica, eminentemente rural, y donde todas las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales.
Raquel, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, y por medio de su trabajo día a día lucha por dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida mejor. Es una persona muy luchadora, que quiere salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y así seguir criándolos para la venta.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa communal bank is made up of a group of neighbors in Santaní, an area that is pretty far from the heart of things and is especially rural.  All the members work in rural activities.

Raquel, one of the members, works raising and selling barnyard animals. Through her work she fights from day to day to give her family what they need for a better life.  She is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead.  She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals, and in this way to keep raising them to sell.

loans.use: Comprar balanceados para animales.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende District of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products and will help Jackson increase his sales and generate greater profits. Jackson hopes that in the future he will be able to have a supermarket. 

Note: Jackson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Santa Clara 2 Group

texts.es:
Santa clara 2 es un grupo nuevo, que forma parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, que lucha por una vida mejor, para poder salir de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ursulina, quien se dedica a las ventas, tiene un pequeño negocio que es una despensa, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio monto, y comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil poder empezar, pero que hoy ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Por medio de su negocio da a su familia lo que necesitan y no pasan por necesidades.
Pide este crédito para comprar insumos para poder surtir su negocio, y comprar verduras, carne, leche, panificados y demás. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santa Clara 2 is a new group. It is a part of the poverty elimination program that is fighting for a better life to be able to get out of poverty. 

One of the members is Ursulina, who works in sales. She has a small business which is a convenience store that she opened with much hard work and sacrifice. She says that at first it was difficult to be able to start it, but today she has a good clientele. Through her business she gives her family what they need and they don't lack anything.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to be able to stock her business. She will buy vegetables, meat, milk, baked goods and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, milk, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is married with no children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Ega has operated a cafe business making rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors.  She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman and has 5 children. She describes herself as an ambitious person. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Mary will use the KES 13,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit 8 family members. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka District of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of them currently in school. For the past six years, Matia has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells home products. 

To help expand his business, Matia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items, such as bread and sugar, for resale. This investment will help Matia generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. 

Matia hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Note: Matia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Matia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items, such as bread and sugar, for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes in order to expand her business

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer es un grupo unido que trabaja y está luchando por salir adelante, está en su ciclo 16 del comité de mujeres, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sara quien tiene un copetín bien surtido donde tiene venta de todo tipo de insumos, y con lo cual está saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de su esfuerzo pudo brindar a su familia lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su copetín, como ser bebidas, golosinas, comestibles y demás, con lo cual podrá dar a su clientela todo lo que pide. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir trabajando
texts.en:
The Renacer [Rebirth] group is in its 16th Women's Committee Program cycle and is part of the Poverty Elimination Program. The members of Renacer have a strong work ethic and solidarity, and each woman strives diligently to make progress. 

Doña Sara is one of the Renacer members. She runs a small, well-stocked restaurant that sells all kinds of goods and that is helping her achieve progress. Doña Sara is a very hardworking woman whose diligent work ethic allows her to meet her family's needs.  

Doña Sara is applying for a loan to purchase supplies for her restaurant, such as drinks, snacks, and other food items. This inventory will allow her to meet all of her clients's needs. Doña Sara is grateful for this opportunity that allows her to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, snacks, foods, and other goods.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a divorcee, aged forty nine years with three children. She lives in a rural setting with her family, and one of her children is still attending school. Her children are aged 17, 20 and 23 years respectively.

She is a farmer who deals in agriculture, especially bananas and coffee growing. Jane is also a cattle keeper and rears cows and goats. Jane has been in this business since 1990. She works six days a week and each day she works for eight hours. Jane also operates a small retail shop which supplements her family income.

Jane started these businesses in order to earn a living and be able to care for her children since she is a single mother.  She has acquired this loan so that she can buy manure and pesticides for manure plantation. Jane sells her agricultural products to traders from the city.      
      
Her dream is to educate her last born who is still attending school but her main challenge is unpredictable weather changes and lack of enough capital. She is hard-working.

loans.use: To buy manure and pesticides

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres son las que integran este grupo, todas ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde se están esforzando por dar a sus familias unas mejores condiciones de vida y elevar su nivel de ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir con ingresos buenos, pero debe seguir trabajando para seguir manteniéndolos. Entre el trabajo que ella hace se destaca la venta de minutas, comidas que ella misma hace, y con lo cual ayuda a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta que está luchando por salir adelante, ya que quiere ir mejorando.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, mandioca, carne, condimentos y demás  para poder vender y generar más ingresos el cual la ayudara a mejorar  su calidad de vida. Todas están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
17 women make up this group, and all of them form part of the program for the elimination of poverty, through which they are working in order to give their families a better quality of life and raise their income level.

One of the group members is Lidia, who in the last survey demonstrated a third tier level of poverty, which is to say she has good income, but must continue working in order to maintain her family.  Among the many jobs that she holds, one stands out, and that is the making of homemade meals, by which she helps her family.  She is a very hard-working and enthusiastic person who is struggling to get ahead, since she wants to keep improving.  

She is asking for a loan in order to buy vegetables, yuca, meat, condiments, and other items in order to be able to sell and generate more income, which will help her improve her quality of life.  

All the group members are very thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, yucca, meat, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumos alimenticios. Trabaja junto con su hijo, tienen un móvil con el cual distribuyen sus productos por los distintos barrios de asunción y alrededores. 
Tiene una antigüedad de más de 10 años en su negocio,  también tiene experiencia y una clientela formada. Mediante este trabajo pudo tener para su casa, en donde cuenta con todas las comodidades, y gracias a lo cual no hace falta nada a su hijo.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking woman who sells food products. She works together with her son and they distribute their products in different neighborhoods in Asunción and its surroundings thanks to a car they own.

They have had this business for more than ten years, not to mention the experience and customers they have accumulated. Through this job, María was able to buy a comfortable house and give her son everything he ever needed.

She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, different types of meat, spices and other things in order to continue preparing her foods and keep on working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, spices and other ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Memuna.  She is married and has 3 children ages 20, 16, and 13. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her for schooling.  In 2007, Memuna established her timber business. She began her business just to enable her to support her children’s education. Her business is located at the outskirts of town, and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Memuna has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new SLL 4,000,000 loan in order to saw leaves of timber.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to buy more stock and improve her stock level. In the future, Memuna plans to own a house, to generate funds to pay her son's college fees and to own an outlet in the middle of town. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 49 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Образование-средне-специальное, окончила техникум по специальности технолог швейных машин. Работала швеей на протяжении 2 лет, затем вышла замуж и после замужества на протяжении 23 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить животноводческую и полеводческую деятельность. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 теленка и 6 овец, а также имеется земельный надел мерою 1,80 ГА на котором она ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер. Супруг Элмиры оказывает услуги односельчанам  при перевозке грузов и имеет небольшой доход. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и полеводства Элмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, а также полученная прибыль поможет приготовить приданое для дочери на свадьбу.
texts.en:
Elmira is 49 years old. She is married and she and her husband are raising two children. She has secondary-level education, having graduated technical college where she majored in sewing. She worked as a seamstress for 2 years, then she got married and since then has spent 23 years rearing animals and developing crops. She started this business with 5,000 Kyrgyz soms. She has been able to develop her livestock and farming activities. On her farm she has two calves and six sheep and also has a 1.8 hectare patch of land, on which she grows beans and clover. 

Elmira's husband works transporting goods for their fellow villagers and he receives a small income. The monthly total profit is 13,000 som. With the goal of further developing her farm Elmira turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 soms to buy bull-calves. Elmira plans to spend the income gained from the loan on increasing her quantity of livestock. The profit could also be used to be put towards a dowry for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy bull-calves

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever es una persona que quiere salir adelante, comenta que lucha por ser un buen profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
Ever está estudiando a carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que quiere ser un excelente profesional exitoso que pueda ser útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma está cada vez más cerca de su meta. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Ever is a person with a strong will to get ahead. He says that he is fighting to become a good professional who is able to help others through his job.

Ever is studying Accounting and wants to become a successful professional, in order to serve his community.

He is requesting this loan to pay for the tuition fees in order to come closer to his goals. He is grateful for this opportunity to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bowls, helping her to boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more empty five-gallon rubber containers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing for resale

loans.name: Ibrahim Sorie

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has 4 children aged 22, 19, 17, and 14. In 1998, Ibrahim established his foodstuffs and used clothing business. He began his business to generate funds to support his children's education. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business.

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy sacks of groundnuts (SLL 2,500,000) and sacks of pepper (SLL 1,500,000). He hopes that this loan will increase his profit level. In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a house in Kenema, to educate his children, and to send his children abroad. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball, okra, pepper, rice, and oil for her business

loans.name: Bona

texts.en:
Bona is 30 years old and lives in the town of Masaka in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 7 years, Bona has been working hard to manage his agricultural inputs business, through which he sells agricultural chemicals. 

To help expand his business, Bona has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more agricultural chemicals, and it will help him to generate greater profits. Bona hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business stock. 

Bona is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bona who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more agricultural chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize for her business

loans.name: Mohamed W.

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has 3 children aged 21, 17, and 14.  In 2003, Mohamed established his stationery business. He began his business to enable him settle his domestic problem. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase dozens of textbooks, a packet of exercise books, and a packet of pens. He hopes that this loan will increase his additional income and stock level. In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house, to educate his children, and to own a car. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy stationery items

loans.name: Siaka Deen

texts.en:
This is 52 year-old Siaka. He is married and has 6 children aged 26, 23, 20,17,15, and 12. In 2011, Siaka established his beverage business. He began his business to continue his economic activities after work. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Siaka would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy crates of Star beer, crates of stout, and crates of soft drinks. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level and hence his profit. In the future, Siaka plans to expand the bar, to build another house, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bread ingredients, thus improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Abdul   Karim

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Abdul. He is married, and has four children aged 18, 15, 13 and 10. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him for schooling.

In 2002, Abdul established his building material and used clothing business. He began his business just to engage himself in an economic activity. His business is located in the city centre and his main customers are mostly men. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy bundles of used clothing. He hopes that this loan will provide him with more funds to settle his domestic commitments. In the future, Abdul plans to build more houses, to educate his children and to buy a car. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine is 40 years old. She is married. with seven children, five of them in school. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more boutique items, such as rice, salt, and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt, and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair products such as hair extensions, hair pomade, hair relaxers, etc

loans.name: Belén De Jesús

texts.es: Belén vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos y, se dedica desde hace algún tiempo a vender mercancía como electrodomésticos pequeños y productos por catálogo, sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside, trabaja sola todos los días de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm y, de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, que fue la motivación inicial para comenzar esta labor; ya que los gastos familiares en algunos momentos se incrementan de manera inesperada, afectando la estabilidad financiera.  Es una mujer pujante, activa y emprendedora, siempre va en busca de nuevas alternativas que le permitan continuar avanzando en su negocio, por ello solicita el crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (electrodomésticos, cosméticos, perfumería, cremas corporales y faciales, entre otros), así podrá aprovechar los descuentos y las promociones que le permiten comprar los artículos a un menor costo, logrando aumentar el margen de utilidad al momento de realizar las ventas, dando como resultado un incremento favorable en la economía de su hogar. Belén quiere seguir trabajando arduamente y abrir las puertas para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de tener su propio almacén de variedades, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y que le permita ofrecer a sus hijos una excelente educación y un mejor bienestar para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Belén lives with her husband and two children. 

For some time now, she has sold merchandise such as small home appliances and mail order products. Her main clients are acquaintances, friends and neighbors from her neighborhood. 

She works alone every day from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm. This is how she earns enough income to support her husband with the burden of the household economy. The initial motivation to start working was that some of the household expenses sometimes increase in an unpredictable manner affecting the financial stability. 

She is a vibrant, active and enterprising woman who is always looking for new ways to continue expanding her business. 

She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale merchandise (home appliances, cosmetics, perfumes, body lotions, face creams etc). This way  she can take advantage of the discounts and sales which allow her to buy the items at a lower cost, increasing her profit margin at the time of sale, resulting in a positive economic outcome for her home. 

Belén wants to keep working hard so that in the future she can fulfill her dream of having her own profitable variety store which will allow her to give her children an excellent education and better welfare for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (home appliances, cosmetics, perfumes, body lotions, face creams etc)

loans.name: José Eliécer

texts.es: José  es un campesino de 35 años de edad, que durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a realizar labores del campo como la agricultura y la ganadería, actividades que aprendió al lado de su familia, durante su infancia y adolescencia. Actualmente trabaja en una parcelación del municipio donde reside, allí realiza diversas labores y oficios varios y, de manera independiente, posee ganado de levante cuya producción es vendida para complementar los ingresos que recibe en su empleo actual. El cliente se caracteriza por ser pujante, activo y dinámico, su persistencia y actitud positiva lo llevan a buscar nuevas alternativas para seguir avanzando; por ello solicita el apoyo de un crédito con el que desea comprar más ganado de levante y lechero, con lo que podrá aumentar su producción y ampliar la oferta de productos, pues podrá complementar los ingresos que recibe y con los que lleva el sustento diario a su hogar. José sueña con poder iniciar su propio cultivo de hortensias, con lo que podrá incursionar en otro campo comercial y así generar una mejor rentabilidad en sus negocios, pues de ellos depende el bienestar y la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 35, lives in the country and has worked the land all his life through agriculture and cattle-raising. He learned these skills from his family when he was a child and adolescent. Currently, he works on a parcel of land in the town where he lives. There, he does a variety of work and independently raises cattle. What he produces is sold so he can complement the income from his current job. Jose is thriving, active and dynamic. His persistence and positive attitude motivate him to seek new alternatives to keep advancing.

For this reason, Jose is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to raise and milk. This will allow him to increase production and offer more products for sale. He will be able to complement his income with the income he makes for household expenses. Jose dreams of starting his own hydrangea crop in order to move into another commercial crop and, therefore, have a more successful business. This is important because his family's well-being and economic stability depends on him.

loans.use: buy buy more cattle to raise and milk.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food kiosk, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a 21-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and one daughter in their small pacca (brick-built) house in the village East Alta in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.

Alima passed Class XII (Grade 12) and her husband, Nur, age 22 years, studied up to class VIII (Grade 8). Their daughter is only three months old.

Alima's husband sells vegetables like potatoes, onions, garlic, green chillies, etc. to the market.  But this business does not provide them enough money to give them a decent lifestyle. Both of them plan to expand their business so their income will be more. 

Alima came to know about BJS and has taken a loan to purchase saplings of green chillies and good quality fertilizers so that they can start cultivating more green chillies in their fields. There is a huge demand for chillies in the present market.

Both Alima and her husband hope to buy a cycle van for their own use to take vegetables to the market as well as renting it for another means of income.  The profit generated from the business will also help them to build up their savings and also help to give their child better education.

loans.use: To purchase saplings and good quality fertilizers for cultivating green chilies.

loans.name: Robeiro

texts.es: Robeiro es un campesino de 50 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos. Desde que era niño su padre le enseñó todas las labores del campo y, gracias a ello, hoy en día puede generar ingresos para el sustento familiar; actualmente posee cultivos de papa criolla y fríjol en un lote arrendado que se los administra un amigo, además posee dos vacas productoras de leche cuyo líquido es vendido para complementar los ingresos familiares y para pagar a su hijo un porcentaje por el pasto que consumen y el concentrado con el que son alimentados. Se caracteriza por su empuje, tenacidad, su entrega y por el amor con el que realiza su labor diariamente. Solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará dos vacas productoras de leche, así tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar su producción y las ventas, dando como resultado una mejora notable en la entrada de ingresos económicos para su familia. Robeiro manifiesta que su mayor interés es seguir luchando por el bienestar de los suyos y por ello seguirá trabajando arduamente para llegar a cumplir el sueño de adquirir una parcela propia en la que pueda cultivar sus productos y pueda tener sus animales, logrando tener una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Robeiro is a 50-year-old farmer. He is married and the father of two children. Since he was a kid, his father taught him everything related to the country life. Thanks to this, he is now able to generate the income that his family needs. A friend of his helps him to grow "papa criolla" [a small, yellow kind of potato] and beans in a piece of land he rents. He also owns two milk cows and sells the milk, receiving an additional income with which he covers some home expenses and pays his son for the hay and the concentrated feed they eat.

He is known to be persistent, tenacious, dedicated to his job, and to do it with love. He is requesting support with this loan, with which he will buy two milk cows, which will result in an increase in his production and a significant improvement of his family’s income. Robeiro says that his main interest is to continue fighting for his family’s well-being, which is why he will continue to work hard in order to make his dream come true: to buy his own piece of land where he can grow his produce and can raise his animals. This will result in financial stability and better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hard-working and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with two children; one is in school and one is underage.

Margaret supplies goat meat to her neighbors and passers-by. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es: Alfredo, a sus 52 años de edad, se dedica a vender mercancía de manera ambulante, en el sector donde reside y en veredas cercanas al municipio donde reside; trabaja de lunes a sábado, ofreciendo productos como ropa y calzado para damas, niños y caballeros; esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica, pues surgió de la crisis económica por la que atravesaba su familia, conformada por su esposa y dos hijos, ya que se encontraba sin empleo y es él quien lleva toda la carga económica. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisetas, tenis, sandalias, blusas, entre otros), de esta forma tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de éstos; permitiendo tener una mejora notable en el nivel de ganancias que obtiene por sus ventas, especialmente en la temporada de fin de año donde la demanda incrementa. Es así como Alfredo desea seguir trabajando por el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su familia, además sueña con tener un almacén consolidado, rentable y que perdure en el tiempo, para dejar un buen legado a sus hijos y disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor en compañía de los suyos.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 52, is a street vendor. He sells different items in the area where he lives, visiting also surrounding villages. He works Monday to Saturday, selling clothes and shoes for women, men and children. He learned by doing, due to a financial crisis his family suffered. His family is composed of his wife and two children. He did not have a job and could not provide for them.

He is now requesting a loan to buy clothes in bulk (jeans, t-shirts, sports shoes, sandals, blouses, etc.). This way, he will have a wider variety to offer to his clients and satisfy their different tastes and needs. This will result in an improvement on the income he receives from his sales, especially during this time of the year, when the demand is higher.

Alfredo wants to continue working to improve the well-being of his family. He also dreams of having a well-known, profitable and sustainable shop, so he can leave his children a good legacy and enjoy the fruits of his labor together with his family.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk: jeans, t-shirts, sports shoes, sandals, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in Uganda. She is married and has four children with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her raw food business. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food for sale, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and to improve her family's standard of living. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her raw food business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more raw food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of bags

loans.name: Sansio

texts.en:
Sansio is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sansio has been working hard to manage his bark cloth business. 

To help expand his business, Sansio has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bark cloth material to sell, and it will help Sansio to generate greater profits and improve his standards of living. Sansio hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Sansio is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sansio who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bark cloth material to sell

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que han luchado por darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida al que ellas tuvieron.
Una de ellas es Irene, quien además de ser integrante de este grupo, es la presidenta, es una persona que trata de fomentar el espíritu emprendedor entre sus compañeras. Ella se dedica a la olería, donde hace ladrillos de muy buena calidad que vende a muy buen precio. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de arcilla para poder seguir haciendo los ladrillos que vende y así poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The 19 members of this group have various businesses.  They are women heads of household who have worked hard to provide a better style of life for their families then the ones they had.

Irene is one of them and aside from being a member of this group; she serves as its president and is one who tries to strengthen the entrepreneurial spirit among her fellow members.  She works as a brick maker and makes good quality bricks that she sells for a good price.  Her dream is to continue growing her business and be able to provide work for others.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy clay to continue making bricks to sell and be able to invest in her business this way.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera tiene una niña de 3 años de edad, actualmente vive con su tía y sus primos, es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta, siempre está buscando la manera de poder salir adelante con su hija, ella se dedica  a la venta de medicina natural, lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda en la casa y logra solventar algunos gastos personales, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina natural por mayor, para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hija.
texts.en: This lady is a single mother and has a three year old daughter.  She currently lives with her aunt and cousins and is a very hardworking, responsible, and honest woman, always searching for a way to get ahead with her daughter.  She sells natural medicines on foot in the various markets near her home and is able to help out with the household expenses and pay some of her personal expenses with her earnings.  She is asking for this loan to buy more natural medicines in quantity, so she can continue her work, since it generates good income for her, so that she and her daughter can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics

loans.name: William

texts.es: El señor William tiene 28 años, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado como también venta de leche él vive en la localidad de Batallas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor William va a usar este préstamo para compra de ganado lechero para crianza por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  el señor William enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar alimento balanceado para sus ganado y así de esta manera poder tener más producción de leche, el  señor William es una persona joven con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en: William is 28 years old, buys and sells livestock, and also sells milk in the town of Batallas.  This will be his first loan through the institution and William will use the money to buy dairy livestock to raise for his business.   He wants to improve his income and quality of life.  He will also buy balanced feed for his livestock and in this way be able to increase his milk production.  William is a young person with a desire to get ahead and he is happy about the opportunity to improve his business and income.  This is his only business.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: La Señora Zoila  tiene 46  años y es casada con tres hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida en su puesta de venta que se encuentra  que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de las Colinas del Urubo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Señora Zoila va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su comida como Aceite, fideo, arroz y papa por mayor,  la Señora Zoila enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas pensiones que se dedican a la venta de comida, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimos platillos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica y con tiempo su deseo es poder tener un restaurante y así brindar mayor comodidad y variedad de platillos a sus clientes y también poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Zoila is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells food out of her home in the Colinas del Urubo zone of Santa Cruz.  This will be her first loan through the institution and Zoila will use the money to buy supplies in quantity, such as cooking oil, noodles, rice, and potatoes.  Zoila has challenges in her business, such as competition from many people who also sell food in her area.  She will use the benefits to continue buying ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes.  She is happy and grateful for this opportunity, since this is her only business and in time she wants to have a restaurant so she can provide better comfort, a greater variety of dishes to her customers, and be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maxilinda

texts.en:
Maxilinda is 53 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maxilinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maxilinda has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 34 years old and married with three children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and from a small restaurant.

Mary Grace aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Maylynda

texts.en:
Maylynda works hard to support her family. Maylynda is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Maylynda requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Maylynda has been in this business for three years now.

Maylynda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has four children, three in school and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 15,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jean Maurice

texts.en:
Jean Maurice is single, and he has been a businessman transporting people on his motorbike for the past two years. 

With the loan he has requested, he plans to buy more motorbike spare parts for use when he needs them to repair his motorbike. 

The profits from the business will be used for making more savings, with a dream of having another motorbike in the future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Paquita is 47 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Paquita has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines. Paquita requested a 20,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Paquita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Paquita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is from Vanadzor town, where he lives with his mother. 

For the past four years, Tigran has been working as a theater and film director at a local theater. He organizes different presentations at theatre and is a   very enthusiastic and hard-working director. 

Now because of hard financial conditions he is not able to save money to buy materials for the preparation of scenery. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Tigran to complete his presentation successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to prepare scenery for perforrmances

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 38 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 15, viven todos juntos en casa propia, ella es una mujer emprendedora que le da mucho apoyo a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar. Se dedica a vender lácteos, esta actividad nace por iniciativa propia, la realiza de lunes a sábado no tiene un horario fijo. Para ella es una activad sencilla que no representa ningún riesgo practicarla.
Invertirá en la compra de quesos y cremas, para venderlo a sus clientes, será de gran ayuda para ella porque tendrá productos de calidad, sus ventas aumentaran, podrá cancelar sus cuotas apoyara más en los gastos de su casa.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable que le de los ingresos necesarios para ahorrar y patrocinar los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 38, is married and has two children aged 8 and 15. They all live in a house of their own. She is an enterprising woman who helps her husband a lot with the home expenses. She sells dairy products. She took the initiative to start this business and works Monday to Saturday, no particular times. This is for her a simple job with no major risks.

She will buy cheese and cream to sell to her customers. This will be of great help for her since she will have access to good-quality products, her sales will increase, and she will be able to pay the installments and contribute even more to the home expenses.

She dreams of having a more profitable business which gives her a good income so she can save and pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cheese and cream to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. Elena is widow and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

Elena requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

Elena has been in this business for eleven years now.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es: Rosa, desde hace 13 años se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició como una opción para generar recursos por cuenta propia, ya que su familia pasaba por una crisis económica luego del fallecimiento de su esposo, por lo cual ella quedó a cargo de sus 3 hijos y lleva las riendas del hogar desde aquel entonces. Conoce la labor desde que era muy pequeña, pues toda su familia ha vivido de este tipo de negocios. Allí ofrece gran cantidad de productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar y trabaja todos los días de la semana para aprovechar la ventaja de que en el sector los habitantes acostumbran a comprar diariamente los alimentos; de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para dar alimento a sus hijos y satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar. El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, carnes frías, galletería, chocolate, café, productos de aseo, granos, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse con más variedad de artículos para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada navideña que se aproxima; esto dará como resultado un incremento en las ganancias que obtiene por su labor. De esta manera Rosa podrá seguir adelante y avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo que es ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, mejorando así la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como la de otras personas que influyan en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Rosa has had her own business, a grocery store, for the past 13 years. 

It started as a way for her to generate income when her family was going through an economic crisis after her husband passed away. 

Since then she has taken care of her three children and all the household costs. 

She has worked since she was very young since her family has had these types of businesses. She offers all kinds of day to day products and she works every day of the week in order to take advantage of the fact that her customers are used to buying food on a daily basis. This way she generates enough income to feed her children and have basic household needs. 

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies at wholesale (pastries, dairy products, cold cuts, cookies, chocolates, coffee, toiletries, grains etc) this way she can have a larger variety of products to satisfy the increasing demand during the Christmas season.

This will increase her profits and Rosa can get closer to her goal of expandingher business and can generate employment opportunities and improve the quality of life of her family as well as people involved in the business.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale (pastries, dairy products, cold cuts, cookies, chocolates, coffee, toiletries, grains etc)

loans.name: Nurnehar

texts.en:
Nurnehar is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a housewife who stays with her husband and two children. Her husband is 39 years old. They live at Horimondirpara in the small town Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own Kaccha (mud and straw made) house.

Both Nurnehar and her husband received no education and can only sign their names. Both of their children receive education. They are in Class IX (Grade 9) and Class V (Grade 5).

Nurnehar’s husband is a farmer. His income is too low to run a family well, so she decided to take a loan from BJS. It will be used to grow potatoes on their lands. With this loan, she wants to buy good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes. This way she will be able to help her husband to meet their growing expenses to run the family.

She hopes to make a profit from this business. This income will enable her to help her husband with the family expenses (educational expenses for the children, health and food) and to reinvest the rest in their business. She also desires to buy a cycle van for their own use and to rent it for another means of income.

loans.use: To buy good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Shushila

texts.en:
Shushila is a married woman of 29 years. She is blessed with two children. Her husband, Subhas, is a farmer. He is 41 years old. They live at West Magurmari in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own Kaccha (straw and mud made) house. Sushila read up to class VII (Grade 7) and Subhas, up to class V (Grade 5). They are providing education to both of their children, though with great difficulty. They read in Class IV (Grade 4) and Class I (Grade 1).

The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where usually potatoes are grown. She and her husband work hard from dawn to dusk to give financial support to their family. But the income is too low to meet the expenses incurred in the family, so she has applied for a loan to BJS to buy more potato seeds and fertilizers for potato growing. She wants to cultivate potatoes and sell those in the local market. She has given potatoes preference as it is a lucrative business and has a great demand.

She hopes to earn a great profit from her business, with which she will be able to meet the financial needs of her family, give a better future to her children and also upgrade their house to a pacca (brick-built) one.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 5 años que decidió por establecer su propio negocio de venta de comidas como baleadas, pastelitos, tacos, pollo frito con tajadas, venta de lácteos y también vende mercadería  como cosméticos, achinería, ropa, calzado, adornos etc. Las ventas las realiza mediante pedidos y entrega a domicilio. Ha invertido varios prestamos para el negocio, El actual es por 20,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar mercadería como cosméticos, estuches navideños, jeans, zapatos, blusas, camisas, short, etc. para la venta en esta época navideña, con el propósito de aumentar su inventario y las ganancias. Su meta es crecer con su negocio, mejorar su casa de habitación y darle a su hijo una mejor educación.
texts.en: Iris is 50 years old and a single mother.  She has a son and they live together in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  Five years ago she decided to set up her own business selling food such as baleadas, meat pies, tacos, fried chicken pieces, dairy products, and also merchandise such as cosmetics, achineria, clothing, decorations, etc.  She sells to order and delivers her merchandise to her customers’ homes.  She has had several loans for her business and the current one is for 20,000 Lempiras, which she will use to buy merchandise such as cosmetics, Christmas boxes, jeans, shoes, blouses, shirts, shorts, etc. for the Christmas season so she can increase her inventory and profit.  Her goal is to grow her business, make improvements to her home, and provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice  for her business

loans.name: Olima

texts.en:
Olima, 25, is a married woman and a housewife. Her husband, Jahangir, is 35 years old. Both of them could not complete their secondary education. They live in their own Kaccha (mud and straw made) house in Barosoria in the district Jalpaiguri with their three children: one daughter and two sons. One of the children goes to school and is in Class IV (Grade 4). The others are below the school-going age.

Olima's husband is a vendor of vegetables in the local market. But due to the competitive market, there are many vegetable vendors in the market, so his income is not sufficient to meet the expenses of his family. 

Olima decided to help her husband by taking a loan from BJS. With the loan she plans to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. After harvesting, she will sell her productions in the local market. There is a great demand for potatoes in the local market.

She hopes to make a profit from this business. This revenue will enable her to help her husband with the family expenses and the expenses of their children's education and to invest the remainder to make a Pacca (brick) house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Jorgina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jorgina de 38 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, los cuales estudian en la universidad. Ella es originaria de  Managua. Ella de caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En la vida ha tenido que luchar duro para poder sobrevivir con sus hijos ya que desde muy joven fue madre. Lamentablemente no pudo seguir estudiando por la responsabilidad que tenía como madre y por falta de apoyo económico. Pero lucha para forma a sus hijos en profesionales  sueño que está a punto de cumplir.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante a clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta cosméticos como vanidad, sombra de ojos, lápiz de ojos, labiales, rubor, crema hidrates, perfumes, body, delineador, crema antiarrugas, crema anteojeras, desmaquilladores, crema limpiadoras. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jorgina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jorgina, 38, is a single mother with two children in her care who are both in college. She is originally from Managua, and is characterized as being hard-working, responsible, and having a desire for personal success. She has had to fight throughout her life to be able to survive with her children since she became a mother at a young age. Unfortunately, she couldn't stay in school because of her responsibilities as a mother and a lack of economic support. However, she works hard so her children can become professionals, which she hopes will come true soon.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, she works by selling cosmetics from her home and by traveling to new and repeat customers. She works ten hours a day selling her products, which is work she enjoys doing. She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock up her cosmetics business with items such as eye shadow, eyeliner, lipstick, blush, hydrating cream, perfume, anti-wrinkle cream, masking cream, make-up remover, and cleansing cream. In the near future, she hopes to have better income. Jorgina is grateful to Kiva lenders who provide a dignified source of work to people with a lack of resources in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with items such as eye shadow, eyeliner, lipstick, blush, hydrating cream, perfume, anti-wrinkle cream, masking cream, make-up remover, and cleansing cream.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат родом из района Шахритус. Ему 24 года. Он молодой семьянин. Шавкат на своем 0,45 га участке земли занимается растениеводством. А его отец занимается перевозкой грузов на своей грузовой машине. Нынче Шавкат хочет начать животноводческую деятельность. У него имеется место для содержания и выращивания скота. Он также запасся одной частью корма для скота, а остальную часть он будет брать со своего земельного участка. Однако для закупа скота его собственного сбережения не хватает и поэтому Шавкат обратился за кредитом. Шавкат планирует каждый месяц покупать по пять голов коров и телят со скотного рынка Шахритус и после откорма продавать на том же рынке, но уже по высокой цене. Шавкат считает это прибыльным бизнесом, который независимо от сезона имеет стабильный доход. Начав данный бизнес он наконец-то сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Shavkat is from Shahrituz. He is 24 years old. He is a young family man. Shavkat works in agriculture on his 0.45 hectare plot of land. His father transports cargo on his truck.  

Shavkat now wants to start a livestock business.  He has the space to keep and breed animals. He stocked up on one part of the feed needed for his livestock, and the rest of the feed will come from harvesting his land. However, he doesn't have sufficient savings to purchase the livestock itself, and so Shavkat has applied for a loan. 

Shavkat plans to buy five cows and calves each month from the cattle market in Shahrituz, fatten them and resell them in the same market, but at a higher price. Shavkat believes that it will be a profitable business, with stable income regardless of the season. By starting this business, he will finally be able to improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy 5 cows and calves

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en:
Jeanelyn is a 30-years-old, single and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Jeanelyn is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Jeanelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mera

texts.en:
Mera is 28 years old and single. She works very hard to help her family.

Mera runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy more household goods like sugar, chips, spices, eggs, noodles, etc.

Mera has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Mera would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more household goods like sugar, chips, spices, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Salvina

texts.en:
Salvina is 61 years old and married with three children. 

Salvina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Salvina requested a 6,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Salvina has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Salvina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for two years now.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Mila Sunshine

texts.en:
Mila Sunshine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.
