She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like eggs, milk, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Mila Sunshine has been in this business for two years. Mila Sunshine earns more income from pig fattening.

Mila Sunshine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like eggs, milk, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Sahida is a 19-year-old housewife. She is married to Manihal, who is 23 years old. They have one child, 2 years old. Sahida and her husband studied up to class IX (grade 9) and Class VII (grade 7), respectively.

Manihal is a farmer. As a farmer, his profit margin is very low, because he could not grow different varieties of vegetables due to lack of capital. 

Sahida thought to help her husband in his business so that their family can run smoothly. For that reason she has taken a loan from BJS to help her husband expand his business by buying potato seeds and fertilizers. He will then sell the potatoes in the market with his other vegetables. 

Selling potatoes is very profitable in their locality because they are used in many Indian dishes.

They hope that they will have a good future and earn a good profit by selling potatoes.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for potato farming.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is married man, aged 38 years, with four children; three are attending different schools in different areas. He also lives in a rural setting with his family: his mother, who is very old, and two of his nephews whose school fees he pays. He is a farmer who deals in growing maize and coffee on a large scale and started his business in 1995.

He works six days in a week and nine hours per day. He started his business to get food for his family and to earn a living. He has acquired this loan to buy more coffee to boost his agricultural business. His clients are traders from the city and those from nearby villages.

His future hope is to be the leading supplier of coffee and maize in his village, and his challenge is weather changes, like too much drought. He describes himself as a hardworking man who encourages lenders to always monitor their clients and find out whether they used the money for the purchase that they took it for.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is 27 years old. She is a housewife who is illiterate and just can sign her name. Her husband, Prosanto, age 34 years, also received no education and just can sign his name.

They have their own small kachha (mud and straw made) house at Magurmari in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They live there with their two children. They go to school and read in class X (Grade 10) and class IX (Grade 9).

The biggest obstacle in Prasanto's and Namita's life is that they have no education. So they chose a milk supply business. They purchase milk from a dairy farm and sell that milk to the market. But they are not earning enough money from this business due to lack of capital, so it is quite difficult for them to meet the expenses of their family and educate their children. 

Namita has decided to help her husband by contributing money to the business. She decided to take loan from BJS so that they can buy more milk and expand their existing business by selling more milk.

They hope that in the future they will be able to develop the business and earn much profit so that they can easily upgrade their financial condition and as well as give proper education to their children. They also desire to upgrade their house to a pakka one.

loans.use: To purchase milk for selling in the market.

loans.name: Khuku

texts.en:
Khuku is a 45-year-old housewife of Nirendrapur village, Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri District. She lives with her husband and two children. She has received  secondary education. Both the children are pursuing their studies. 

Her husband is a farmer, involved in the agricultural business, and grows different kinds of seasonal vegetables on their own land, then sells them to the market. Khuku gives assistance to her husband in his business. 

Now she plans to take a loan to invest in potato growing by buying necessary supplies like potato seeds, fertilizers etc. 

She has a kacha house (made of mud, straw, bamboo, etc.). In the future she hopes to build a beautiful concrete house of her own with the profits from her business.  She is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Tapashi

texts.en:
Tapashi is a very brave 40-year-old lady with many dreams. She is a housewife of Dhupguri town and the mother of two children. She has received secondary education up to grade 10. Her children are below school-going age, but she hopes to give them a good education.

Tapashi’s husband is involved in the agricultural business. They have their own land but due to lack of finances, Tapashi and her husband couldn’t use their land, so she decided to take a loan for potato cultivation to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. 

Potato is in high demand in that area and as well as throughout West Bengal. That’s why they have decided to grow potatoes and hope it can be  profitable for them.

In the future, with the profit of her business, she wishes to build a concrete house where they can live happily. She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potato.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of medication, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, sugar milk etc., thus aiding her in improving her overall ‘Ahee’ sales.

loans.name: G.s. El Alfarero Group

texts.es:
El g.s. El Alfarero está conformado por tres integrantes madres solteras con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Nagarote, lugar que se destaca por su artesanía y comida típica. Estas mujeres son responsables, trabajadora, con ganas de salir adelante. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del g.s. es Yenifer y tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, leche, pan, detergente, jabón, fósforos, frutas, tiste, sopa magi.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s.  El Alfarero agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
There are three members, all single mothers, in the El Alfarero group. Between them they are responsible for seven children. They are natives of Nagarote, a place well-known for its crafts and local food specialities. The women are responsible and hardworking with a great desire to get ahead in life. In their free time they enjoy being with their children. Sadly, because they are poor, they weren't able to go to school but had to work from a young age to help pay for household expenses.

The coordinator of the group is Yenifer because she is energetic and keen to make progress. She runs a small store selling groceries etc. in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, milk, bread, detergent, soap, matches, fruit, tiste [local drink], and Magi soup. Yenifer works in her store 12 hours a day so she can increase her income.

The El Alfarero group is grateful to Kiva donors who give the chance of a better life to poor people in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: To buy stock for her grocery store such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, milk, bread, detergent, soap, matches, fruit, and packet soup

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is very nice lady of 55 years. She lives in the Achadjur village of the Tavush region. She has a small and lovely family; she lives with her husband and her son. Susanna is already a very respected and pleasant client of Nor Horizon and Kiva. Her first loan from Kiva helped her to fence off her garden and to buy persimmon and fig trees. She has a very beautiful and colorful vineyard and a fruit garden full of plums, apples, persimmons and pomegranate trees. Susanna and all of her family members are employed, but they all just love gardening and they do their best in order to manage their gardening activities together with their work. They use the harvest from their garden both for their family and to sell as well.

Susanna asks for a loan of 1,100,000 AMD in order to buy some new trees and also to organize autumn sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy some new trees for her orchard and also to organize autumn sowing activities

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Vanadzor town with his mother, wife and two daughters. 

Over 10 years, Artur has worked as a taxi driver using his own car.  He mainly drives to Yerevan-Vanadzor and Vanadzor-Georgia and he has a lot of customers. They prefer to travel such far distances in his taxi since he drives attentively and very carefully.

For tackling financial hardships, Artur also has a small furniture-production business in his garage, but because of the many difficulties he faces with the furniture-making business, the main profitable activity is taxi driving. 

Currently, his car needs to be renovated so he isn't able to drive the taxi. Realizing the importance of the income from taxi driving business, Artur has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Artur and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario se dedica a la reparacion y pintado de carrocerías; grardabarros y protecciones exteriores. 
El vive en anticretico, ubicada en El Alto del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Hilario es comprar maquinaria (Compresora) que le es de mucha necesidad para mejorar su  trabajo, puesto que  el que tiene actualmente se encuentra oxidado y en mal estado y asi no puede brindar un buen servicio. esta es la razón por la que solicita el crédito, para comprar una nueva compresora.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Hilario works in a bodywork shop repairing and painting vehicles, mudguards, and providing exterior protection. He lives in Anticretico in El Alto, department of La Paz, about an hour from the city of La Paz.

Hilario's Greatest wish is to buy more equipment like a much-needed compressor so he can improve his workmanship. His current one is rusty and in poor condition so he cannot do good work with it. For this reason he is seeking a loan to buy a new compressor.

This is his third loan with IMPRO and his second with Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a compressor for his bodywork repair shop

loans.name: Vecinos Unidos Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Vecinos unidos está conformado por 9 integrantes, siete mujeres y dos hombres. Padres y madres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de su familia. Actividad que disfrutan mucho ya estas personas tiene que trabajar desde muy temprano hasta tarde para llevar el alimento a su familia. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco  es  Mabel y  tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos lácteos como cuajada, leche, en su casa de habitación, y de forma ambulante. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de leche, cuajada, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener  mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Vecinos Unidos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank of Vecinos Unidos (Neighbours United) is made up of 9 members, seven women and two men. Fathers and mothers who are responsible for 15 children between them, they are originally from Malpaisillo, situated in the north of the country. They are hard working, responsible people, who want to personally be successful and who enjoy spending their spare time with their family. This is an activity they enjoy a lot as these people have to work from early morning to late to provide food for their family. Unfortunately they could not study and saw the need to work from an early age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to their efforts and desire to succeed, the coordinator of the group/bank is Mabel who sells dairy products like curd, milk, both from her home and as a traveling vendor. She spends about 8 hours a day selling her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest as working capital and to stock up her business by buying milk and curd, so that in the near future she can get a better income. The Vecinos Unidos community bank thanks Kiva lender for the help they provide to people with few means and to poor countries like Nicaragua to allow them to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: invest as working capital and to increase levels of stock

loans.name: Dúo Bienaventuradas Group

texts.es:
DUO BIENAVENTURADAS
Este dúo formado por doña Angélica Marisela, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, solo uno de ellos va a la escuela, tiene 26 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace 1 año, solicita este crédito porque quiere comprar leña y maíz por quintal, ya que el precio es más favorable y se lo van a dejar a su casa y así no gasta pasaje para comprar, y su ganancia seria un poco mayor ya que la leña también al comprar por media camionada le sale mas barato, espera que fape le ayude ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie para mantener a sus hijas,y por medio de su negocio es como ella sostiene a su familia, el sueño de ella es darles estudio a sus hijas para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
DUO BIENAVENTURADAS

Angélica Marisela is part of this duet.  She is a single mother, and she has two children.  Only one of them goes to school.  She is 26 years old, and she has been selling tortillas at her house for one year.

She is requesting this loan because she wants to buy firewood and corn by the ‘quintal’ [a quintal is 100 pounds].  This is because the price is better, and they will leave it at her house.  This way she does not waste the cost of traveling to make the purchase.  Her profit will be a little more because purchasing the firewood by the truckload is also cheaper.

She hopes that FAPE will help her because she does not have help from anyone else to support her daughters.  It is through her business that she supports her family.  Her dream is to give her daughters an education so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, es una señora de 48 años de edad, vive con su padre, ella es la que cubre los gastos de familia con los ingresos que obtiene de la pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa desde hace un año, fue una iniciativa propia la que la llevo hacer su proyecto realidad, la atiende todos los días sin un horario especifico, pues depende como estén las ventas. Por el hecho de estar ubicada en su casa se le es fácil estar pendiente de atender a su papá.
Ella invertirá en la compra arroz, sal, azúcar, bebidas, maíz, azúcar, aceite y otros, todo con el fin de surtir más su tienda, tener ventas abundantes, seguir cumpliendo con las exigencias de sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más amplio, cancelar la deuda adquirida, darle una alimentación adecuada a la familia y que sus clientes cada día sean más.
texts.en:
Ana, age 48, lives with her father.  She is the one who covers the family expenses with the income that she gets from a small store that she has had in her house for one year.  It was her own initiative that caused her to make her project a reality.  She tends to the store every day without a specific schedule, depending on how the sales are going.  Because the business is in her house, it is easy for her care for her father.

She will use the loan to buy rice, salt, sugar, drinks, corn, cooking oil, and others.  She will buy all of this in order to better stock her store, to have abundant sales, and to continue meeting her customer demand.

Her dream is to have a bigger business, to pay off her debt, to adequately feed her family, and for her clientele to grow more and more.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, sugar, drinks, corn, cooking oil, and others.

loans.name: Ruth Cintya

texts.es: La señora Ruth tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo que depende de sus ingresos, cuenta con un grado de instrucción de nivel técnico en Fabricación de calzados y diseño computarizado, trabaja en un taller y se dedica al Servicio de Fabricación de Calzado de Cuero con el cargo de Soladora con una antigüedad de 1 año de experiencia en el rubro,  por otro lado tiene una segunda actividad que es el Servicio de Gastronomía con una antigüedad de 3 años vendiendo comida por las mañanas. Actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar maquinarias e insumos para que en un futuro pueda dedicarse a trabajar como Soladora.
texts.en: Señora Ruth is 24 years old. She is single and has a son who depends on her income. She went to school through a technical level in fabrication of shoes and computerized design. She works in a workshop and makes leather shoes;  her work is putting soles on shoes, and she has a  year of experience in this job. On the side, she has a second business, food service, where she has three years of experience selling food in the mornings. She is now applying for a loan to buy machines and supplies so that in the future she can work [on her own] soling shoes.

loans.use: to buy machinery and supplies

loans.name: G.s. Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario  Bendición de Dios está conformado por seis integrantes madres y padres  responsables con cinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad.  Ella son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Este grupo se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta, disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente no pudo cursar estudio y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del g.s. es  Carla y tiene por actividad económica la venta de calzado de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto como sandalias, zapatillas, deportivos, de niños, de cuero. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s. Bendición de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
There are seven members in the Bendición de Dios Group. They are responsible mothers and fathers who are raising five children between them. They are from El Sauce in the north of the country. The group is known for its hard work, responsibility, and desire to get ahead. In their free time they enjoy being with their children. They were not able to attend school as they had to work from a young age.

Carla is the coordinator of the group as she is energetic and keen to make progress. She earns her living selling shoes in the streets and from her house. She spends about eight hours a day at work selling sandals, shoes, runners, children's shoes, and leather footwear. Carla needs a loan so she can buy more stock and earn more money in the not too distant future. 

The Bendición de Dios Group is grateful to Kiva donors who give the chance of a better life to poor people in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: Buy stock such as sports shoes, leather footwear and sandals for her shoe stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad, tiene un nivel académico de bachiller comercial, está acompañada y vive con su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar como agricultor; sus hijos esta pequeños, dos estudian uno tercer grado, otro primer grado y su tercer hijo esta pequeño tiene 6 meses de vida. 

Ella vive junto a sus padres, ya que siempre han sido una familia muy unida y trabajadora. María, se dedica a trabajar como empleada  doméstica, este tipo de trabajo lo ha aprendido desde que era una niña, ya que por los escasos recursos económicos, con los que contaba su familia, la hiso trabajar a temprana edad, para tener un ingreso extra, ya que sus hermanos, ayudaban a su padre en la agricultura y también cuando ella no trabajaba como empleada doméstica lo hacía con su padre en los cultivos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca, con la cual podrá tener un ingreso con la venta de la leche y el alimento para la vaca, será los restos de la cosecha que saque su familia, la necesidad satisfecha será que podrá realizar el negocio de la compra y así tener ese ingreso extra.

Ella desea en un  futuro, darle a sus hijos lo que a ella le fue negado por los escasos recursos económicos, con los que contaban en su familia, ella desea tener un trabajo que le genere un ingreso mayor y que sea basado a lo que estudio, para salir adelante, construir una casa para ya no estar junto con sus padres y crecer a sus hijos por el buen camino, que tengan valores y principios y sean respetados en la comunidad.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old and has a high school degree in commerce. She lives together with her husband who is a farmer. Their children are young: two are studying, one in third grade and one in first grade, and the third is only 6 months old.

They live together with her parents. They have always been a very united and hard-working family. María makes a living as a domestic worker. She learned this skill when she was a girl. Because of their scarce economic resources of her family, they had her work from a young age so as to have an extra source of income. Her brothers helped their father in the fields, and when she was not doing domestic work, she did as well.

The loan she is requesting to Fundación Campo will be used to buy a cow, with which she will have an income through the sale of milk. The cow will be fed from the harvest of her family. She will thus satisfy her wish to do this purchase and to have an extra income.

She wishes to be able to give to her children what she was denied because of the scarce economic resources of her family. She wishes to have a job that will generate her a higher income, one that is based on her studies. She also wants to get ahead, to build a house so as to no longer live with her parents, and to guide her children along a good path where they have values and principles and are accepted by the community.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, pepper, rice, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo, es casado  tiene cuatro hijos , vive en casa de sus padres en la comunidad Arajllanga – Provincia Aroma del departamento de La Paz.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundaria. El es agricultor  y se dedica a la cria de ganado y elaboracion de queso.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de Ganado ( un par de vacas lecheras)para incrementar su producción de leche  y tambien de queso.
El sueño de Reynaldo es tener varias vacas  para asi poder cumplir con sus requerimientos elaboracion de queso  y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
Es el segundo que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is married with four children, lives with his parents in the community of Arajllanga - Province of Aroma in La Paz.
He studied until the end of high school. He's a farmer, raises cattle and also makes cheese.

The loan he is asking for is purchase 'Ganado' (a pair of cows for milking) to increase his production of milk and also of cheese.
Reynaldo's dream is to have various cows so that he can meet his requirements for cheese making and in this way improve his income.
This is the second loan he has solicited from IMPRO and his first from KIVA.

loans.use: buy a  pair of milking cows increase his production of milk and also of cheese.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio es casado, tiene dos hijos , vive en casa propia en la comunidad Arrajllanga provincia Aroma .
El estudio hasta el nivel primario. El es Agricultor y Elaboracion de Queso juntamente con su esposa y sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ganado (una vaca lechera) asi poder cumplir con su requerimiento de demanda de queso y tambien tener un incremento en su volumen de leche.
El sueño de Eugenio, es tener varias vacas lecheras para asi poder cumplir con su requerimiento elaboracion de queso dar mejor calidad de vida y mejorar sus ingresos.
Es el segundo que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Eugenio is married with two children and lives in his own house in the community of Arrajllanga in the province of Aroma.
He completed elementary school. He's a farmer and he makes cheese with his wife and his children.

The loan is needed to purchase a 'ganado' (a milking cow) so that he can meet his demand for cheese and also to increase the quantity of cheese he produces.

Eugenio's dream is to have various milking cows so that he can meet his requirements to make cheese, to provide a better quality of life for his family and improve his income.
This is the second loan he has solicited from IMPRO and the first from KIVA.

loans.use: purchase a 'ganado' (a milking cow) so that he can meet his demand for cheese

loans.name: Florilyn

texts.en:
Florilyn is 47 years old and is married with six children.  Florilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Florilyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from making hollow blocks.

Florilyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor, es casado tiene dos hijos , vive en casa propia la misma se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Arajllanga de la provincia Aroma del departamento de La Paz.
El estudio hasta el nivel primaria. Es agricultor se dedica a la cria de ganado y elaboracion de queso juntamente con su esposa.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ganado (una vaca lechera) y  asi poder cumplir con sus requerimiento y entrega de queso diariamente.
El sueño de Victor  es que su casa tenga vacas para asi poder tener mejores ingresos y calidad de vida dar buena educacion a  sus hijos.
Es el segundo que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Victor is married and has 2 children.  He lives in his own home, which is located in the community of Arajllanga in Aroma province in the department of La Paz.

Victor has an elementary school education.  He is a farmer who raises cattle and makes cheese.  He does this work with his wife. Victor needs a loan to buy cattle (a dairy cow) so that he can fulfill his obligations and make his daily cheese deliveries. Victor's dream is to have cows so that he can generate more income and provide his children with a good quality of life and a good education.

This is the second loan that Victor has requested from IMPRO, and the first one he's requested with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce cheese

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, es una señora de 45 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos de 21, 19 y 6 años, vive con dos de sus hijos, su nuera y un nieto de 3 años de edad. Desde hace 15 años trabaja a tiempo completo en su granja de pollos. Con el apoyo de su familia puede realizar sin ningún problema esta actividad.
Comprará vitaminas, concentrado y pollos de un día de nacidos, para críalos y luego comercializarlos, ella busca incrementar la producción de su granja, ya que en estos meses de fin de año las ventas aumentan por las graduaciones escolares y la época navideña.
Anhela tener un negocio más amplio, mejor su economía para cancelar las deudas y darle a su familia acceso a una alimentación más adecuada, salud y educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 45 year old lady who has a partner and three children aged 21, 19 and 6 years old. She lives with her children, her daughter-in-law and one grandson aged 3. For 15 years she has worked full time on her chicken farm. With the support of her family, she can carry out this activity without any problems.

She will buy vitamins, concentrated feed and one day old chicks so that she can raise them and sell them. She is looking to increase the production of her farm as in these last few months of the year sales go up due to school graduations and the festive season.

She longs for a larger business, to better economic standing so that she can settle her debts and give her family better access to food, health and quality education.

loans.use: vitamins, concentrated feed and one day old chicks

loans.name: Dúo Los Claveles De Santiago Group

texts.es: Dúo Los Claveles de Santiago, integrado por doña Rosa Maria de 47 años casada, su esposo se dedica a la reparación de placas dentales desde hace 10 años, doña Rosa se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas para toda ocasión, si le piden algún diseño en especial, ella se esmera para lograr tener la réplica para quedar bien con sus clientes y así dar referencias, en la elaboración lleva muchas cosas como alambre para hacer la formación, papel china para darle forma, papel periódico, y pegamento,  está feliz por su logro ya que sus hijos han estudiado y se han superado en esta ocacion esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de piñatas, esperando que ustedes nuevamente la ayuden ya que el sueño de ella es tener un negocio mas grande que el actual.
texts.en: The partners "Los claveles de Santiago" or "Carnations of Santiago" include Rosa María, who is 47 years old and married, and her husband, who has worked repairing dental plates for the past ten years.  Rosa works making piñatas for all occasions.  If her customers request a special design, she works hard to replicate whatever they have requested.  Making piñatas requires many diverse products such as the wire for the form, crepe paper for the body, newspaper, glue, etc.  She is happy for her accomplishments since her children have been able to attend school and have been able to move forward in life.  Currently she is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for making piñatas.  She hopes that Kiva lenders will once again help her reach her dream of having a larger business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en: Liberathe is 59 years old. She is married with six children. She sells bananas and has spent five years in the business. With the loans, she would like to buy bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Magdalid

texts.es: Magdalid es una mujer de 49 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar. Durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a la elaboración de manualidades, tiene su taller ubicado en la casa donde reside, allí elabora cuadros al óleo, artículos de decoración en arte country, y, en vísperas de la temporada de fin de año elabora artículos navideños, trabaja sola todos los días de 5:00 am a 10:00 pm; todo este arte que elabora con sus manos, es vendida a familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector para así generar los recursos económicos con los que sostiene su hogar. Su empeño, creatividad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se le han presentado. Esto la motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará insumos al por mayor (telas, paños, hilos, pinturas, cintas, entre otros) y pagar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, así podrá tener material disponible para elaborar gran cantidad de artículos y satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada navideña, gracias a la tradición que viven las familias del sector y de la ciudad. Magdalid sueña con tener un taller más amplio y bien consolidado, que sea rentable y que perdure en el tiempo, para que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable y así poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de los suyos.
texts.en:
Magdalid is a 49 year old single mother with three children and is the head of the household. 

She has made craft work during her entire working life. Her workshop is located in her home. There she makes oil paintings, decorative art country items and during the holiday season she makes Christmas items. She works every day from 5:00 am to 10:00 pm. 

The craft work that she makes with her hands is sold to acquaintances, friends and neighbors. This is how she generates the economic resources to maintain her home. 

Her dedication, creativity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead in spite of the difficulties that have arisen. This has motivated her to ask for support in the form of a loan. 

With the loan she will buy supplies at wholesale (fabric, cloth, yarn, paint, tape, etc) as well as pay off the balance of a loan. This way she can have material available to make a large quantity of items and satisfy the increased demand during the Christmas season thanks to the traditions of the families in her neighborhood. 

Magdalidad dreams of having a larger, well funded, profitable workshop giving her an economic stability.  In this way she will be able to enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale (fabric, cloth, yarn, paint, tape, etc) as well as pay off the balance of a loan.

loans.name: Elsa Emerita

texts.es:
Elsa de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, actualmente está separada de su esposo, vive con sus hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando uno 4° grado y el otro 6° grado  y también  un hijo de 20 años el cual vive con ella y es quien se encarga de los trabajos en el hogar junto con los otros hermanos,  ella también tiene 2 hijos que están en el extranjero.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan artesanal, esto lo hace desde que tenía 15 años; ya que la mamá se dedicaba a este negocio. Ella aprendió a elaborar distintas variedades de pan, cuando se independizo de su familia, empezó a trabajar en este rubro; para obtener  ingresos de dinero, para brindar la educación a sus hijos y salir adelante con todos los gastos del hogar, toda la vida se ha dedicado a la elaboración de pan.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arena, cemento, hierro, y pagara mano de obra; ya que quiere fraguar dentro de su casa, si ella compra todo de una sola ves tendrá una rebaja en los costos, debido a que los trasladara de un solo viaje y todo lo que necesita, el ahorro será grande en las compras.

En el futuro cercano, ella quiere terminar de arreglar su casa y darles a sus hijos toda la educación que a ella le fue negada por su familia, la ayuda del crédito será muy grande,  para ella ya que podrá ver realizado sus sueños de tener su casa terminada y ampliar su negocio para tener más ingresos y salir adelanto con todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 30 years old, has completed 6th grade, is currently separated from her husband, lives with her children (2 of whom are in school with one in 4th grade and the other in 6th grade) and also with a 20 year old son. She is in charge of taking care of the home along with her other siblings and she also has 2 children who are abroad.

She makes traditional bread and she has been doing this for 15 years as her mother also had this as a business. She learned how to make various types of bread and when she became independent from her family she started working in this area to make some money, provide an education for her children and come out ahead of her household expenses. All her life she has been making bread.

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy sand, cement, iron and pay for labour costs as she wants to set herself up in her house. If she buys all the materials at once they will be cheaper as she only has to make one trip to pick them up and she will make great savings on her purchases.

In the near future she wants to finish fixing her house and give her children all the education which was denied her by her family. The loan will help greatly for her to be able to see her dreams of having a finished home come true, to expand her business and have more income so that she can come out ahead of her expenses.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, iron and pay for labour costs so she can work from her home

loans.name: Estela Del Carmen

texts.es: Estela de 26 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este a su alcense para dar a su familia mejores condiciones a las que ella ha tenido. Desde hace mucho tiempo estela se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad.  Junto a su esposo llevan la economía de su hogar y dan a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Con el fin de terminar su casa la cual comenzó hace algunos meses solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas ya que no alcanzó a comprarlas y desea terminarla lo antes posible para poder mudarse.
texts.en: Estela is 26 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and young son, who is 6 years old.  Estela is an enterprising woman who does everything that she can to give her family a better life than she has had.  For some time, Estela has made a living selling clothes as a street vendor in various parts of town.  With her husband, Estela is able to contribute to the household finances and provide her children with better living conditions.  In order to finish building her house, which she started some months ago, Estela is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy door and windows, which she could not afford.  She wants to finish the house as soon as possible so that the family can move into it.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows and to make her home more secure.

loans.name: Lenny

texts.es:
Lenny es separada, tiene dos hijos los cuales no se encuentran con ella , vive en alquiler en una casa la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel licienciatura. Ella tiene una consultoria donde presta servicios judiciales y tambien ayuda socialmente en algunos casos. Su oficina está ubicada en la  zona 12 de octubre 
de la ciudad de el alto .
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de computadora para asi poder cumplir más facilmente  con sus labores y cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes.
El sueño de Lenny  es ayudar a la gente de menos recursos con mayores problemas a bajos costos.
Es el primer crédito que solicita  junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lenny is separated and has 2 children who do not live with her.  She lives in a rented house that is located in the Ciudad Satelite neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

Lenny has a legal degree.  She has a consulting business where she provides legal services and also social services in some cases.  Her office is located in the "12 de Octubre" neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  

Lenny needs a loan to buy a computer so that she can do her work more easily and meet the needs of her customers.  Lenny's dream is to help low-income people who have major problems at a low cost.  This is the first loan that she has requested jointly from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a computer to facilitate her work as a lawyer

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es casada, tiene seis hijos, vive en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Arrajllanga -Provincia Aroma.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primaria. Ella juntamente con su esposo se dedica a la elaboracion de queso y posteriormente a la venta de dicho producto.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de alimento para su ganado ( afrecho) para asi mantener a sus vacas en perfectas condiciones para que den buena leche y poder cumplir con sus requerimiento de queso por parte de sus clientes. 
El sueño de Lidia es tener alimento en cantidad para su ganado ya que  así podrá ahorrar en el transporte y tener mejores ingresos.
Es el segundo crédito que solicita  junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lidia is married, she has six children, she lives in her own house located in the Arrajllanga community, Aroma province. She studied up until the primary level. She, along with her husband, makes her living making cheese and later selling said product. She needs the loan for the purchase of feed for her cattle (bran) in order maintain her cows in perfect condition so that they give good milk and so she can fulfill her cheese requirement on the part of her customers.

Lidia's dream is to have a quantity of feed for her cattle so that she will be able to save on transportation and have better income. This is the second loan that she is applying for from IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bran, a feed for her cows, to feed them regularly so that they give good milk for the production of cheese.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato está agradecido a todos los inversionistas pues le ayudo mucho con el crédito y continua con la agricultura, el continua teniendo varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra plátanos, yucas y maíz. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y  otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Fortunato is grateful to all lenders of his previous loan as it was very helpful. He has continued with his farming and continues to have various plots of land which he cultivates by sowing plantains, yuccas (cassavas) and maize. He has been a farmer for a number of years now and he does very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

He belongs to the “Las Palmeras del Manu" community bank and on this occasion requires the loan to buy seeds and other items. He is grateful for and values this loan and he commits to meeting his monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera, vive junto a su hija y a su nieta, desde hace 10 años debido a la necesidad de tener ingresos para criar y educar a su hija, inicio la venta de ropa por iniciativa propia, realiza esta actividad desde las 6:00 a. m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., aunque este horario varía dependiendo las ventas, hoy es apoyada por su hija.
Comprará ropa (variedad de estilos, colores y tallas) y ropa interior, con esté crédito tendrá un inventario muy equipado para esta temporada  que es cuando las ventas aumentan, así cancelara la deuda y seguirá aportando para los gastos de su casa.
Aspira a tener un negocio que se mantenga activo por su propia rentabilidad y crear un patrimonio para su familia.
texts.en:
María is a single mother.  She has been living with her daughter and granddaughter for ten years.  Given that she needed an income to raise her daughter, through her own initiative María started a business selling clothes.  She works from 6am until 5pm, though the exact hours depend on sales.  María is supported by her daughter.

This loan will be used to buy clothes (in a variety of styles, colours, and sizes) and underwear.  With the loan, María will have more inventory for this season.  Sales increase at this team of year and so María will be able to pay off her debt and continue helping to cover household costs.

María aspires to have her own business that stays profitable.  She also wants to leave an inheritance to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is a 30 year-old married woman with three children.  Two of the children attend school.  

With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and beer for sale.

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es:
Enoc de 55 años, es una persona muy trabajadora su nivel académico es universitario, ya que era maestro antes. Es  casado, su esposa  también es maestra,  procrearon dos hijas una de ellas está estudiando en la universidad periodismo y la otra está en preparatoria, con él vive la mamá,  ya que los demás hermanos están en el extranjero, son una familia muy unida y comprometida.

Enoc se dedica actualmente al destazo de cerdos, ganado y vender comida desde hace 8 años,  que es el tiempo que dejo de laborar como maestro, este negocio lo aprendió de parte de su padre quien desde muy pequeño le enseño este rubro; pero él no lo ejercía sino hasta hoy en día,  ya que antes era maestro, las compras de los animales las hace en le tiangue municipal o en los cantones y caseríos cercanos a la ciudad. 


Con el crédito comprara 2 vacas y un cerdo para destazo, ya que si los compra tendrá un ahorro y una ganancia en la venta ya que comprara más barato y venderá a un precio justo, que le generara ganancia con la cual podrá salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar con su familia.

Los sueños que se verán cumplidos, es poder tener un ingreso que la satisfaga en todos sus gastos, ya que desea que su hija se gradué en periodismo y mandarla a especializarse al extranjero al igual que su hija menor culmine todos sus estudios.
texts.en:
Enoc is 55 years old and very hard-working.  He studied at university and was a teacher.  Enoc is married and his wife is also a teacher.  The couple has two children: one is studying journalism at university and the other is at a pre-university institution.  Enoc's mother also lives in the house.  His siblings live abroad but the family is very close and united.

Enoc currently makes a living slaughtering pigs and cattle, and selling meals.  He has been doing this work for eight years, ever since he left his teaching job.  Enoc learned this trade from his father who taught Enoc from a young age.  Enoc, however, did not work in this same field until now as he was teaching.  Enoc buys the animals in the town of Tiangue, or in the nearby cantons and villages.

This loan will be used to buy two cows and a pig to slaughter.  If he buys these animals, he will make a saving as he will be able to buy them cheaper.  He will then sell them at a fair price and make a good profit.  Then Enoc can get ahead and cover the family's household costs.

Enoc's dream is to have an income that will cover all his costs.  He wants his daughter to graduate in journalism and to send her abroad to specialise.  Enoc also wants his other daughter to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy two cows and a pig to slaughter.

loans.name: Narcelita

texts.en:
Narcelita is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a vegetable and spices vending business in the Philippines.

Narcelita requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell in her vegetable food stall.  She has been in this business for 21 years now and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Dora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dora, es una mujer de 44 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad, debido a la necesidad de ayudar a cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos, concreto el sueño de tener su propio negocio, es así como instalo una pupuseria en su residencia, trabaja sábados y domingos, la atiende junto a su familia.
Comprará chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, tomates, repollo y aderezos. La inversión le ayudara a fortalecer más su negocio, tendrá la materia prima para que su trabajo no sea interrumpido por alguna eventualidad, y tendrá los ingresos necesarios para cancelar las cuotas.
Sueña con ver a sus carreras académicas finalizadas, mantener su negocio activo y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Dora, who is 44, is married and has two children aged 20 and 18. In order to help meet her children's educational costs, she fulfilled her dream of having her own business. This was how she came to set up a pupusa shop [a shop selling Salvadoran stuffed corn tortillas] in her own home. She works in her shop on Saturdays and Sundays, together with her family.

She intends to buy ground pork, soft cheese, oil, tomatoes, cabbage and seasoning. The loan will help her to strengthen her business. She will have the raw materials, which means that her business will not be affected by any emergencies, and she will receive the necessary income to be able to meet her loan repayments.

Her dream is to see her children's education completed, to keep her business going, and to help her husband with the household costs.

loans.use: to buy ground pork, soft cheese, oil, tomatoes, cabbage and seasoning.

loans.name: Gabriel Alonso

texts.es: Gabriel es un campesino de 42 años de edad, casado y padre de 2 hijos. Durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a ser productor agropecuario, pues posee cultivos de maíz y fríjol, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside; actualmente trabaja solo ya que su esposa quien es su mayor apoyo, se encuentra con dificultades de salud, lo que para él significa pasar por un gran desafío; sin embargo, con esfuerzo, amor y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante y siempre va en busca de nuevas alternativas que le permitan continuar avanzando; es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el que desea comprar una ternera de levante, pues desea incursionar en otro mercado para complementar los ingresos y brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar. Gabriel sueña con hacer de sus actividades un negocio rentable, que perdure en el tiempo y que le garantice una estabilidad económica, pues su principal sueño es poder brindar a sus hijos una excelente educación para que sean personas de bien, además quiere seguir trabajando en sus cultivos y lograr percibir mejores ingresos para dar mejores condiciones de vida a los que ama.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a 42 year old married farmer with 2 children. 

He has always worked as a farmer. He has corn and bean crops which are harvested and sold at the municipal market where he lives. 

Currently he is the only one working as his wife, who is his biggest economic support, is suffering from health issues. 

However, with effort, love and dedication he has been able to get ahead and is always looking for new alternatives which will let him advance. 

This is why he is asking for a loan. He will buy cattle. He wants to venture into another area of business to complement his income and improve the well being of his family. 

Gabriel dreams of having a profitable business that last a long time and guarantees him economic stability. 

His biggest dream is to give his children and excellent education. He also wants to keep farming and increasing his income and provide  better living conditions to the ones he loves.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carrots, cabbage, apples, grapes, etc.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina, tiene tres hijos, actualmente vive junto a uno sus hijo, su nuera y un pequeño nieto, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, ella inicio este negocio porque tenía la responsabilidad de brindarles salud, vestuario y alimentación digna a sus hijos, pues es madre soltera. Hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en realizar esta actividad económica.
Con el crédito comprara blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, trajes para niños, vestidos para niñas y calzado variedad de estilos colores y tallas, con la inversión tendrá una variedad de productos para ofrecer en la época navideña, espera aumentar sus ventas, cancelar bien sus deudas, seguir trabajado y satisfacer a sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande, una mejor economía, seguir apoyando a su familia y tener más clientela.
texts.en:
Martina has three children and currently lives with one of them, her daughter-in-law and a little grandson. For the last 10 years she has been selling clothes and shoes, a business she started because she was responsible for the health, clothing and feeding of her children as she is a single mother. To date she has never had any problems in carrying out this activity.

With the loan she will buy blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, clothes for boys, dresses for girls and footwear in various styles, colors and sizes. With this investment she will have a variety of products to offer for the festive season when she hopes to increase her sales, settle her debts and keep working to satisfy her customers.

Her dream is to have a bigger business, better financial conditions and to keep supporting her family and have more clients.

loans.use: buy blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, clothes for boys, dresses for girls and footwear

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora 51 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo quien a la fecha ya es mayor de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles lo necesario. Ella se dedica  a la prestación de servicios domésticos y junto a su hijo quien ya le ayuda en la economía del hogar van saliendo adelante y mejorando sus condiciones. Su casa es muy humilde y no ha podido terminarla puesto que no le alcanza el dinero para hacer el desembolso. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas para darle a su vivienda y familia mayor seguridad. Espera poder obtener la ayuda solicitada ya que no puede hacerlo de otra forma.
texts.en:
Dora, 51, is a single mother with one son who, to date, is of age. All of her life she has worked very hard to get her family ahead and give them what they need. She makes her living offering domestic services and with her son, who helps her with the economy of the home, they are moving forward and improving their conditions. Her house is very humble and she has not been able to finish it since she doesn't have enough money to make the payment.

She is applying for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of doors and windows to give her home and her family better security. She hopes to be able to obtain the requested help since she cannot do it in another manner.

loans.use: to buy: doors and windows to give her home and family better security.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, sugar and onions for resale.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Meet Umu.  She is 40 years old and comes from the Masuba Northern area in Makeni. She is married with one child who is 12 years old.  For the past 13 years, Umu established her building materials business. She began her business because she considered it as the best way to improve her life. Umu works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00p m, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are storage facilities and the high cost of transportation.

Umu requires a loan in order to purchase more cement, zinc and paint for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to empower herself and increase her business. In the future, Umu plans to expand and open more branches in other towns. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cement, zinc and paint for resale

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona is a repeat client for the institution. She has a retail shop in Rwenkurijo Trading Center, Rukungiri District. She has operated this shop for the last six years. She has been taking out loans from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for her business. However, now she is borrowing 5,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy building materials to complete her house.

Elona is married with four children, three attending school. She works with her husband who is also a teacher like her. Both Elona and her husband are grateful for the financial assistance which has improved their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Addah

texts.en:
Addah is a new client who has come to the institution for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. She is a single lady who is separated with her husband. She takes care of her two children who are now going to school. She comes from a rural area in the Nyarushanje-Rukungiri district. She has been in teaching for many years, but found that the income from teaching was not enough to sustain herself and her family. The reason she went into agriculture was to get additional income.

Her challenge has been a lack of capital to buy farm inputs to increase her output and earn more income. She hopes that with this loan she will increase the size of her banana plantation, buy fertilizers and increase her output. Her future plans are to buy more land for agricultural expansion, build a house and get school fees for her children. In the photo is the client and the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Odina

texts.en:
Odina is 22 years old. She is single. She sells clothes and has been running the business for one year. 

She has requested the loan to buy more trousers and jackets for sale. She is planning to use the profits for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: María Fabiola

texts.es: María, a sus 59 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos. Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes empresas de marroquinería, elaborando bolsos y otros artículos en cuero, pero, hace algunos años, el último empleador que tuvo, le dio la oportunidad de trabajar desde su casa, realizando el trabajo de marroquinería para terceros; luego comenzó a combinar esta actividad con la elaboración de su línea propia, sin descuidar los contratos que le llegaban; de esta forma aumentaba sus ingresos con los que aporta para solventar las necesidades de su familia. La cliente es una mujer creativa, intuitiva y muy organizada; su negocio le ha ayudado de una manera muy significativa para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Actualmente solicita el crédito con el interés de comprar insumos y materia prima al por mayor (cuero, hilos, tinturas, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de inventario necesario para culminar la producción que tiene pendiente y así poder mejorar las ventas para la temporada de fin de año que se aproxima. María manifiesta que actualmente su principal reto es fortalecer su negocio, especialmente en la elaboración de artículos de su línea propia, sin descuidar las solicitudes que le hacen para prestar el servicio a terceros; pues de esta manera mantiene su planta de producción ocupada durante todo el año, garantizando una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida al lado de los suyos.
texts.en:
María, 59, is married and the mother of two children. 

She has worked for different luggage companies, making bags and other leather goods. However a few years ago, the last employer she has, gave her the opportunity to work from home working on leather goods for third parties. She has combined this with her own line, without affecting the contracts she gets. In this way she increased her income and was able to better help with the needs of her family. 

She is a creative, intuitive and very organized woman. the business has helped her in a very significant manner to improve the conditions of her family. 

Currently she is requesting a loan so she can buy supplies and raw material at wholesale (leather, thread, dyes etc.).

This will allow her to have inventory available to finish the current production and in this way improve her sales for the upcoming end of year season. 

Maria says her main goal is to strengthen her business especially her own line of items, without neglecting the orders she gets from the third party service she does. 

This way she can keep her production line busy during the whole year guaranteeing economic stability and can enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw material at wholesale (leather, thread, dyes etc.).

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur operating a buy and sell, ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell.  Jocelyn has been in this business for 1 year.  She also earns additional income from frozen food vending.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Pie

texts.en:
Pie is 31 years old. He is married to a business woman. They have one child aged three. 

Pie owns a mini alimentation from which he sells a variety of beverages and snacks. He is requesting the loan to buy more sodas, juice and bread to sell  in his orderly shop. The profits from the business will be used to make savings for the better future of the business.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, juice and bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more electrical supplies such as extension cords and electronic items for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Luz Al Amanecer Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz al Amanecer, representado por Iris de 22 años soltera, Iris tiene una panadería desde hace 4 años, inicio vendiendo en la puerta de su casa ahora ya tiene un local que alquila, queda cerca del mercado Municipal de Santiago, ella se levanta temprano para poder vender ya que hay muchas personas quienes la buscan,ya que en el area ella es la primera pesona que habre su panaderia muy temprano está feliz porque ya termino de estudiar ahora desea invertir en venta de ropa para dama y aprovechar el espacio que aun tiene en su local,pero para eso tiene que tener mas capital es por esa razon que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de pan y compra de ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
Dúo Luz al Amanecer is represented by Iris, who is 22 years old and single. She has had a bakery for four years. She started by selling in the doorway of her house and now has a shop that she rents. Her shop is near the Municipal Market of Santiago.

Iris gets up early to start sales because she has many customers who seek her out since hers is the first bakery in the area to open very early.

She is happy because she has already finished her studies and now wants to invest in selling women’s clothing and make good use of extra space she has in her shop. However to do so, she has to have more capital. Consequently, she is requesting this loan in order to buy bread as well as clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bread and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, vegetables, fish and other ingredients for the preparation of the food.

loans.name: Yesenia Beatriz

texts.es: Yesenia de 32 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 10 y 8 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para  darles mejores condiciones de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado poner una pequeña sala de belleza  en su lugar de residencia la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar y poco a poco van saliendo adelante. Con la finalidad de dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda y a su familia desea construir un muro perimetral para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro de esta forma espera dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 32 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and her two daughters who are 10 and 8 years old. For her, the most important thing is her family and it is because of this that she works hard to give them better living conditions. With much effort, she has managed to open in her residence a small beauty parlor, which is her main source of income. Along with her husband, she maintains the economy of her home, and little by little they are coming out ahead. 

With the goal of giving better security to her home and her family, she wishes to construct a perimeter wall for which she is requesting this loan from FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, and iron. In this way, she hopes to give better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and iron to construct a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Mollecato Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOLLECATO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa ella es conviviente y tiene 53 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría animales como pollos y patos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados y 
ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y patos.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “MOLLECATO.” This bank is located in the Urcos district, part of the Quispicanchis province and the Cusco department.

One member is Tomasa. She has a live-in partner, is 53 years old, and has two children. She works in her business raising animals. She raises animals like chickens and ducks. She fattens and grows them, and then she sells them in the different markets and fairs. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has made a living through this business for five years and it is going very well for her. Tomasa’s dream is to have a space where she can sell the animals. She is requesting this loan to purchase chickens and ducks.

The other members make their livings through the sale of animals, a business selling agriculture, a grocery store, and a business selling food.

Tomasa is thankful to those who are becoming a part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lipstick, creams, lotions, powder, bases, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rubber bowls, buckets and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more auto spare parts, like engine oil and radiators for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Мутабару 51 год. Она верная жена, мама и бабушка троих внуков. Мутабар со своей семьей живет в городе Конибодом. Мутабар более 20 лет работает учительницей в местной школе. На данный момент она является заместителем директора в школе. Зарплата у Мутабара не большая, поэтому она дополнительно дома в течение 10 лет занимается  скотоводством. В этой деятельности ей помогает муж. Мутабар хочет взять кредит, чтобы купить несколько голов скота. Тогда она увеличить поголовья скотов и увеличиться ее деятельность. Мутабар верит, что ей помогут. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку!
texts.en: Mutabar is 51 years old.  She is a loyal wife, mother and grandmother to three grandsons.  Mutabar and her family live in the city of Konibodom.  Mutabar has been working as a teacher at a local school for over 20 years.  Currently, she is an assistant director at the school.  Mutabar's salary is not high and this is why she has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years.  Her husband helps her with this business.  Mutabar wants to obtain a loan to buy several heads of livestock.  Then will increase her livestock headcount and grow her business.  Mutabar believes that she will be helped.  She hopes for Your support!

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Kadija from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is single and has one child.  For the past seven years, Kadija has had her clothing material business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home.  She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Kadija requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Kadija plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 53 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosita has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, eastern rural area of Freetown. She is married and blessed with five children. She started her business to take care of her family.

Fatmata runs a palm oil business from home; she sells palm oil and peppers. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is the cost of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

Mary Jane has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, a 48-year-old woman from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown.  She is married with 4 children.  Fatmata has operated her retail business for the past 11 years. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and charcoal to expand her business.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her wellbeing and increase her business.  In the future, Fatmata plans to open a food stuff table.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children.  She began her business because she wants to improve her status of living. In 2009, Fatmata established her local food business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometime sales are very slow.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more items like rice, sugar and milk to prepare her local food business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her installment. In the future, Fatmata plans to change her business to a provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, sugar and milk to prepare her local food business.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ninfa is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Isatu from Waterloo Eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and has two children.  Her children are currently attending school. For the past 15 years, Isatu has had her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and buy a generator to improve their standard of living. In the future, Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing in order to expand her business, thus allowing her to meet rising customers.

loans.name: Krista

texts.en:
Krista started her home-based business, "Krista’s Just Jewelry", after becoming a mother. She wanted to spend time with her children but also wanted to contribute to her household financially and provide for her husband and children.

What Krista needed was a job that she could do at home and that allowed her the flexibility of setting her own schedule, and, with "Krista’s Just Jewelry", Krista created the ideal work environment she was looking for. Through this business, Krista offers handmade bracelets, necklaces, and other small accessories and sells them at parties, local events and to her extended network of family and friends.

Krista will use this loan to purchase materials to make her accessories. Help this mother meet her loan goal and pursue her dream of being a successful working mom.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make her small, handmade accessories.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en: Eugenio is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as an active person. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He describes his family challenge to be that they live in a dry area. He will use the 20,000 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful dairy farmer. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase advertising space in local papers, online, and on the radio for her pest control business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Susan is borrowing 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for farm-related work for her rice-farming business.

Lita has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from making nipa roofing.

Lita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for farm-related work

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
