He will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, insecticides, seeds, breaks, spokes, and tire patches.  With these items he will prepare land for planting and will equip his business for repairs.  This will provide an abundant harvest, satisfied clients, and will increase his income.

With the previous loan his harvest was of much higher quality, and his business inventory was supplied.  His income increased and with it he had the opportunity to add another small venture which is the selling of fire wood.  He continues working in order to gain the economic means to purchase his own house in order to enjoy it along with his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticides, seeds, breaks, spokes, and tire patches.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a spare parts shop. He wants to increase his net sales and income as his current income is insufficient to meet the family needs.

Therefore, Sajida is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of spare parts by purchasing a wide variety of automobile spare parts. Sajida hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase spare auto parts.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 41 year old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Irshad has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Irshad is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
On the picture Solmaz is together with her grandchildren. 

She is 59 years old, married, and has seven children and 16 grandchildren together with her husband. They are pensioners now. As the main source of income for her family, Solmaz and her husband are involved in poultry and vegetable selling.  

Thanks to their hard work, the farm now contains a big hen coop and greenhouse.

Solmaz plans to invest the income from the business to further grow the number of domestic animals on her farm and plans to accumulate funds to fully repair a house. 

Today the purpose of her requested loan is for the building of a bathroom inside the house.

loans.use: To cover the building of a bathroom inside the house.

loans.name: Tahora

texts.en:
Tahora is 45 years old and hard-working. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons, and three daughters. One son and two daughters are studying in school.  

She and her husband have owned a crockery shop for five years, which is the only source of income for the family. Now for the further growth of their business, Tahora has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to buy more crockery items for their shop.  

Their family expenditures are too much higher as compared to monthly income and savings.  Therefore she wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit amount. As a result of that, they can increase their monthly income as well as savings. 

Her dreams are for higher education of her children. And she is very much thankful to KIVA for such a great help and kindness

loans.use: to buy more crockery products for her shop

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es: María de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo quien es jornalero y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. María se dedica a la venta de ropa en diferentes zonas de su comunidad. Gracias a que es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y carismática ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Su vivienda es muy humilde y poco a poco va mejorando. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada y madera para pavimentar el corredor de su vivienda y al mismo tiempo techarlo ya que cuando  llueve el agua se filtra y daña sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en:
María is 22 and lives in her own home with her husband, who is a day-labourer. She helps him with the household costs. Maria sells clothing in different areas of her local community. As she is an enterprising, responsible and charismatic woman, she has succeeded in gaining the trust of a lot of customers, who are choosing her services more and more frequently.

Her house is very humble, and she is slowly improving it. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement, sand, gravel, galvanised sheeting and wood to pave the corridor of her house. At the same time, she is going to roof it, because when it rains the water comes in and causes damage to the few belongings she has.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanised sheeting and wood to pave and roof the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Dúo Los Encantos Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS ENCANTOS
Doña Lilian lucrecia, es originaria de Patzicia Chimaltenango, ella tiene 24 años de edad, ella se dedida a la elaboracion y venta de ropa tipica. Desde hace años ella empezó con un pequeño negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante, gracias al apoyo de su familia.
El crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que asi podrá ofrecer a su clientela mas variedad de productos.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, ya que asi tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mejorar su calidad de vida, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de ropa tipica.
texts.en:
DUO LOS ENCANTOS

Lilian Lucrecia is originally from Patzicia Chimaltenango. She is 24 years old and works by making and selling traditional clothing. Several years ago, she started a small business and, thanks to God, she was able to slowly move forward with her family's help.

She will use the loan she received to invest in her business so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

Her dream is to grow her business in order to have more income and a better quality of life. She is requesting this loan to buy materials to make and sell traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor, es soltera, vive con sus tres hijos y dos nietos. Se dedica a vender conchas, jaibas, variedad de pescado y semilla de marañón y otros productos, son actividades que aprendió dentro su familia, desde hace 16 años emprendió su negocio propio, es con los ingresos que obtiene de él que saca adelante a su familia.
Comprará pescados, camarones, conchas, moluscos, entre otros, con lo que espera tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, aumentar sus ganancias y cancelar la deuda.
Sueña ampliar el negocio con otro tipo de productos, mejorar la alimentación, educación y salud de su familia.
texts.en: Leonor, a single woman, lives with her three children and two grandchildren. She sells shellfish, crabs, a variety of fish, cashews, and other products. These are activities she picked up from working within the industry for 16 years before starting her own business. It's with the revenues she obtains from the business that she supports her family. The loan will be used to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, mollusks, and others, with which she expects to have more products to offer her customers, helping her to increase profits and pay off her debt. She dreams of expanding her business with other products and improving the nutrition, health, and education of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, mollusks, and other seafood

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 44-year-old, hard working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, daughter, and four sons. Her husband is a barber by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past four years, he has also driven taxi at night. Currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in future. Naseem desires to provide quality education to all of her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay for repairing a taxi engine.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is married and the mother of two. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community.

Saima has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy stocks of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy cloths relevant to the winter season.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She will use the 8,700 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. She also does farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is 33 years old and is a hard working and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and three daughters. All of her children are studying in school. Her husband is a security guard and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. For two years, Jamila has been running a beauty salon and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Jamila has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: Eulogio agradece a todos los inversionistas que le ayudaron con el crédito y se siente muy contento de ser parte de este proyecto, él continua viviendo en la ciudad de Salvación y continua dedicándose a la agricultura y él continua tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra plátanos, piña, yucas y maíz. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizante y otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Eulogio is is extremely pleased to be part of this project and would like to thank all of the lenders who helped him with his prior loan. He still lives in the city of Salvación and still runs a farm to make a living. He continues to manage several fields where he plants bananas, pineapples, yucca, and corn. Eulogio has run the farm for several years and his diligent efforts are paying off as the farm is doing very well. 

Eulogio belongs to the "Las Palmeras del Manu" ["The Palms of Manu"] Communal Bank and is now applying for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other items. Eulogio is grateful for the loan and conscious of its value to his business, and is therefore determined to make his monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Solidario Hombres Trabajadores Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO HOMBRES TRABAJADORERS
Don Alberto es originario del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 24 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus tres hijos menores de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando diferentes tipos de productos como, maíz, frijol, hortalizas y verduras.
El ha venido realizando esta actividad desde hace algunos años, gracias al apoyo de su esposa, y al buen corazon de Kiva que le an ayudado con credito don Alberto sigue trabajando en la agricultura.
El sueño de el es ampliar mas su negocio, tener capital para sus siembras ya que esi tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para continuar con su trabajo en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Hard-working Men's group: Alberto is from the city of Tecpan Guatemala and is 24 years old.  Under his care are his three younger brothers.  He farms, planting different types of crops like corn, beans, and vegetables.  He has been working in this field for some time, and thanks to the support of his wife and Kiva's generosity with credit he has been able to continue working in agriculture.

His dream is to grow his business, to have capital for planting, since that will help him improve his income, and to be able to send his children to school.  At this time he is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers in order to continue his agricultural labors.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for agriculture.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura left the Dominican Republic over 10 years ago with years of experience in the hair styling and salon industry and a dream of one day owning her own salon.

Last year, she decided to make that dream a reality and opened Orquidea’s Beauty Salon in Brooklyn, NY. At the salon, Rosaura provides salon and hairstyling services and sells hair products. She and her four employees strive to maintain a clean, tidy, and welcoming salon that offers high quality styling, good service, and affordable hair care products.

Rosaura’s business has grown quickly and even the City of Brooklyn has taken notice. She recently received an award from the city on the one-year anniversary of her salon’s opening, thanking her for creating jobs for the community. 

Rosaura is also extraordinarily generous and thoughtful both in business and in her personal life. She contributes financially to the educational expenses of her family members who are still in the Dominican Republic. She has also created a private room in the back of her salon where she caters to Muslim women who, for religious reasons, cannot have their hair seen in public.

This outstanding businesswoman will use her loan to purchase new equipment and expand her hair care inventory. Help her meet her loan goal.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for her salon and expand her hair care inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has always been passionate about helping people and contributing to some greater societal good. His generous and helpful spirit, matched with eight years of experience in the home energy performance industry, has led Charles to his latest venture: N6 Energy.

With N6 Energy, Charles provides home and business owners with insulation, air sealing, and Nest thermostat services. In addition to this technical expertise, he also acts as a consultant, advising clients on how to create a long-term plan of action for energy efficiency, which will result in reduction of energy waste and carbon emissions.

“I was driven to create N6 Energy because I feel I can help homeowners in New England make their homes more comfortable while reducing energy waste in the process. Solutions for correcting climate change need to be practical and serve a dual benefit. N6 Energy’s mission is rooted in just such an ideal.”

Now this earth-conscious entrepreneur needs your help. With this loan, Charles will be able to purchase the equipment and commercial insurance necessary to become an approved Home Performance Contractor in the “Mass Save Home Energy Services Program”.

Help Charles become an approved contractor and decrease energy waste.

Check out N6 Energy here: www.n6energy.com.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and commercial insurance.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo first earned his stripes as a mechanic in Cuba, where he learned to repair cars and motorcycles with minimal resources. After moving to the US almost 50 years ago, Guillermo continued his career as a mechanic, and in 2007 he was bitten by the entrepreneurial bug and decided to start GMT Service.

GMT Service is a testament to Guillermo’s growth as a mechanic and as a businessman. Things are much different from his time as a mechanic in Cuba. Now, he has all the technology and contacts with main distributors necessary to offer the very best service to customers looking for tires for their car, truck, or van. He also offers a wide range of services, including oil changes, tire services, and rotation. 

He considers his greatest success to be fulfilling his dream of business ownership and he is happy that he is able to feel the satisfaction of helping people in need of quality service at an honest and fair price.

Guillermo will use this loan to add more auto parts and tires to his inventory.

Help Guillermo expand his inventory, expand his business, and support his wife.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy buttons, thread, fabric, zippers and to maintain her sewing machine.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 51 years old and married.  

Beverly is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Beverly has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years now, and she has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Beverly would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita works hard to support her family. Cristita is married and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Cristitahas requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish for making dried fish.

Cristita has been in this business for 13 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish for making dried fish for her business

loans.name: Nelsi Evelin

texts.es:
Nelsi  es una persona de 23 años de edad, a su temprana edad es madre soltera de dos preciosas niñas, de 5 y 2 años, sola mente posee a su mamá quien le apoya con el cuidado de sus niñas mientras ella trabaja, ya que su papá murió cuando era una niña, por lo cual debe trabajar duramente para llevar el alimento al hogar.

Actualmente, Nelsi se dedica a la tortillería, posee 3 años de mantenerse en dicha actividad productiva, se estima que posee un don, ya que su producto es muy codiciado por los consumidores y su propósito es aumentar su negocio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una plancha más grande, que le permita incrementar su producción y de una manera más ágil, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, también pretende comprar ropa para obtener otros ingresos en sus ratos de ocio, y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y las de su familia. 

Su propósito, es incrementar su negocio, que le permita ir trabajando el futuro de sus niñas, comenta que no visualiza actividad más productiva que la que ella ejerce, es padre y madre para sus hijas, pero no será un obstáculo para ver logrados sus propósitos a futuro.
texts.en:
Nelsi is 23 years old. At her young age she is a single mother of two precious daughters who are 5 and 2 years old. She only has her mother to help support her with the care of her children while she works because her father died when she was a young girl. Because of this she has to work very hard to provide sustenance to her home.

Currently, Nelsi works producing tortillas. She has performed this activity for three years. She thinks that she has a gift because her product is coveted by her customers. Her goal is to increase the size of her business.

She is seeking this loan to purchase a larger griddle that will allow her to increase her production in an agile way in order to bring better services to her customers. In addition, she intends to purchase clothing to obtain other earnings in her spare time. Through these means she will improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Her goal is to grow her business which will let her work for the future of her daughters. She told us that she does not know of an activity that is more productive that the one she is doing. She is both the father and the mother of her children, but it is not an obstacle in the way of her achieving her goals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a larger griddle that will allow her to increase her production in an agile way.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 46-year-old married woman, who lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband drives an ambulance which does not belong to him; he has to pay a daily fare to the owner. A few days ago he got into a road accident while driving and the ambulance sustained serious damages. The ambulance owner is imposing a penalty upon him which is beyond his earning capacity. He wants to buy his own ambulance to drive so that he does not have to pay the fare on a daily basis. 
Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan which is the field partner of Kiva. She hopes that through this amount her husband would be able to repair the ambulance so that he can drive it again. 
She belongs to a poor family.  Her husband is the only single earning person and does not have any other source of income. 
Shehnaz seems very glad and thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the ambulance her husband drives.

loans.name: Irampocho

texts.en: Irampocho is a well-bred person. She was born in 1972. She is a widow and has two children. Her children are adults. Their ages range from about 20- to 22-years-old. She works hard and has worked more than eleven years in a café. She is a waitress. Her working day begins in the early morning and ends in the late evening. This is how Irampocho earns money for a living. Her son is a migrant in Russia. She is ill. Doctors gave a warning to her that the illness is dangerous. She has no money to buy medicine for her treatment. She is asking for a loan of 2,400 Somoni to buy medicine for treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her treatment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as an ambitious person. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food. 

Her family's challenge is traveling long distances to fetch water. She will use the KES 13,000 loan to buy  a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy  a water tank

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as intelligent. She operates a tailoring business where she makes and repairs clothes. She describes her family's challenge to be water problems and poor drainage. 

She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy an energy-saving cooking jiko (a charcoal stove) to enable her cook efficiently.

She hopes that in the future, she will construct a permanent house. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy an energy-saving cooking stove

loans.name: Blanca Sonia

texts.es:
Blanca, ve en los créditos una herramienta muy útil para poder invertir  en el negocio, necesita comprar maíz, leña, bolsas y papel. Espera tener los resultados del crédito anterior como lo son mejorar su servicio, tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas, mejores ganancias.
Se siente satisfecha por poder contar con un negocio más estable, que le siga dando ingresos para pagar los estudios de sus hijos, darles mejor alimentación. Todos están muy saludables y siguen cooperándole para que el negocio siga activo.
texts.en: Blanca sees loans as a very useful tool to invest in her business. She needs to buy corn, firewood, bags, and paper. She hopes to have the same results from her previous loan, including improved service, more customers, increased sales, and better income. She is glad she can count on having a more stable business, which continues to provide her with income to pay for her children's educations and provide them with better nutrition. They are all very healthy and keep working together to keep the business going.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, bags, and paper.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a polite and aggressive person. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap and other items. She describes her family's challenge to be poor drainage and water shortage. 

She will use the KES 7,900 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting their house. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married man with three children, one of whom attends school and two of whom are underage. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, he has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He mentioned seasonality and theft as his major challenges. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 he wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es un Microempresario  que tiene 37 Años de edad, se dedica a la Venta y Reparación de todo tipo de accesorios para vehiculos, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, siendo esta su fuente principal fuente de ingresos.
Don Francisco está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de aceites, bujías, parabrisas, etc. y asi tener el producto suficiente para poder atender mejor a sus clientes, espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda y le permita mejorar un poco su negocio, su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don Francisco su sueño es que su negocio sea uno de los mas reconocidos  de su comunidad.

 
Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco is a 37-year-old micro-entrepreneur. He sells all types of spare parts and accessories for vehicles, a business that he has been in for 10 years and that is his principal source of income.

Don Francisco is applying for the loan to buy oils, spark plugs, windshields, etc., to thus have sufficient products to be able to serve his customers better. He expects that this investment will be of much help to him and will allow him to improve his business a little, along with his quality of life and that of his family. Don Francisco's dream is that his business be one of the most recognized in the community.

 
Trojes, Honduras - November 2013.

loans.use: to buy oils, spark plugs, windshields, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha was born in 1977. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in a sector in Jordan called Salt. Her husband is a retired man who currently works in security and protection. 

Rasha has been selling blankets for four years. She started her project with selling a small quantity of them, and she found it profitable. 

Now she wants to buy a larger number of blankets to sell during winter and to earn better income that will help her support her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy blankets and clothes for sale

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Noor was born in 1989. She is single and lives with her mother and six siblings at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Her father passed away, so she is trying her best to support her family financially. 

Noor has been selling blankets for one year. She started her project with selling a small quantity of them, and she found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of blankets to sell them during winter and to earn more income that will help her support her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a collection of blankets to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 20 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his five siblings and his parents. His father is a manager at a desserts store. 

Mohammad is studying Computer Science in his third year. He is planning to continue his study to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. 

But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 29 years old and hard-working.  She lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and two daughters. One son and both daughters are studying.  Her husband is an auto mechanic. 

His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Nazeeran is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Nazeeran has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. 

She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow her business by adding additional products that are unusual in other stores in the area, such as grains and clothing.

loans.name: Jailane

texts.en:
Jailane  is married and lives in Lintugop, Aurora, with her family.  She earns a living by selling ice and ice candy. Jailane has been doing this business for six years and is now engaged in selling ice cream in town.  

Jailane's previous  loan  from GDMPC, used to purchase new equipment and tools, has been successfully repaid. She requests a new loan to purchase raw ingredients to prepare ice cream. Jailane hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare ice cream

loans.name: Hurinisso

texts.ru: Хуриниссо родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Основным источником семьи является выращивание сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращивает зерно и овощи как картофель, лук, морковь и зерно. Хуриниссо является владельцем своего бизнеса. Его старший сын помогает ей введению бизнеса. Хуриниссо имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Так как семья большая, а доход семьи маленький, Хуриниссо и ее семья живут бедно. Она не имеет денег даже для того, чтобы организовать свадебное торжество своего сына. Она не получила в этот год намеченный урожай. Она запрашивает займ для проведения свадебного торжества сына. Этот займ пожжет молодому человеку из села горного Таджикистана организовать семью.
texts.en:
Hurinisso was born and raised in the countryside.  She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of three adult children.  Her family derives its main source of income from agriculture, essentially growing grains and vegetables such as potatoes, onions and carrots. 

Hurinisso owns her farming business, and she runs it with her oldest son.  She also makes an additional income from animal husbandry.  However, because the family is large, and their income is small, Hurinisso and her family are poor.  She doesn't have enough money to pay for her son's wedding party.

Hurinisso did not get the harvest she expected this year, so she is taking a loan to be able to celebrate her son's wedding.  This loan will help a young man from a village, in the mountains of Tajikistan, to start a family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding celebration.

loans.name: Madafu Group

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman and a mother of one boy who is in school. Asha, who is in her early 30's, has been running a mamalishe (small café) business for one year. She is doing great with her business. Asha works at her business from 6 AM to 4 PM and is able to win a fair monthly return. 

From Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request which she will use to buy more food supplies like beans, maize flour, and baking flour for her mamalishe. Asha dreams of owning a hotel in the future. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Madafu, which totals four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food supplies like beans, maize flour, and baking flour for her mamalishe (small café).

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as a credible person. He operates a farm where he grows crops. He also owns a grinding mill where he grinds maize to produce maize flour for sell. 

He describes his family's challenge as the shortage of water, especially during the dry season. He will use the KES 31,460 loan to buy two water tanks and connection pipes. This will enable his family store clean water for use during the dry season. He hopes that in the future, he will be a self-reliant person and will have access to a constant supply of clean water. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy two water tanks and connection pipes

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a focused person. She operates a farm where she grows crops to sell. 

Veronicah describes her family's challenge as the shortage of rainfall. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. This will benefit 11 family members. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a bigger tank.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. She describes herself as a focused person. She operates a green grocery where she sells groceries.She also grows crops in her farm to earn extra income. 

She describes her family's challenge to be lack of water connections to irrigate their farm. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy water pipes to enable them irrigate their farm. She hopes that in the future, she will have enough food.

loans.use: buy water pipes

loans.name: Basel

texts.en: Basel is 21 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafarq with his nine siblings and his parents. Basel is a fourth year student studying geology and environment. He is planning to continue his studies and find a job in his field of study after graduation in order to start earning a better income to help his family financially. However, he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Kefaya

texts.en:
Kefaya was born in 1971. She is married and has thirteen children. Her husband is a security guard and works in car trading at the same time. 

He also has a mini-market which Kefaya is helping him with. Kefaya has been running her husband's mini market for one year. They started this project with selling a small quantity of food products, and they found their project a good source of income. 

Now Kefaya wants to raise the quantity of food products her husband sells in order to raise their profit and income to be able to cover their children's needs. But they don’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, Kefaya applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products for her mini-market

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, es casada, tiene tres hijos de 15, 17 y 20 años.  Vive junto a sus hijos, se dedica a cultivar maíz y a tender su granja de pollos, toda su vida ha desempeñado estas actividades por lo que ya tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio y hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema.
Con el capital comprara plaguicidas, fertilizantes, semilla, abono y concentrado para pollos, está inversión le ayudara a tener más amplio su inventario y poder sembrar sin ningún inconveniente, mejorara su producción, tendrá clientes satisfechos y aumentara sus ingresos.
Desea fortalecer más su negocio, aumentar su clientela, cancelar sus deudas, mejorar la alimentación de su familia, darles acceso a salud y a educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Catalina is married and has three children, ages 15, 17, and 20. She lives with her children. She grows corn and raises chickens. She has worked at these activities all her life, because she already has a lot of experience in this business, and up to now she has not had any problems.

With the capital, she will buy pesticides, fertilizers, seeds, compost, and concentrated chicken feed. This investment will help her to have greater stock and to be able to plant without any inconveniences. She will improve her production, have satisfied customers, and increase her income.

She wants to strengthen her business more, increase her clientele, pay off her debts, improve her family's nutrition, and give them access to health and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers, seeds, compost, and concentrated chicken feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 46-year-old married woman. She has two children, 12 and 16 years old. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, rice, flour, and other items. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the 5,500 KES loan to buy a gas cooker to enable her family to cook efficiently. She hopes that in the future, she will live comfortably. She also does farming to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: 04-07-06-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thêm has a service business, tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth to use in her tailoring business. Thêm is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thêm is the group leader of the 04-07-06-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2008, Thêm joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thêm has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thêm has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship Thêm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thêm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to use in her tailoring business

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as polite. She operates a retail business in which she sells charcoal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low demand. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use and to add stock of charcoal for sale. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and a stock of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 27 years old and married with two children.

Emelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, toothpaste, snack foods, cereals, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Emelyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets.

Emelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, toothpaste, snack foods, cereals, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, tiene una hija de 2 años, es casada, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos aprendió por su cuenta hacer pupusas, es en negocio que atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta 7:00 p.m., es un negocio que no le ha dado problemas para administrarlo.
Comprará repollo, chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, maíz, teniendo materia prima disponible se le facilitara aumentar su producción, tener más ingresos, atender mejor a sus clientes, cancelar la deuda y atraer a nuevos clientes.
Anhele tener un negocio más estable, mejorar el local, seguir aportando en los gastos de casa y tener un patrimonio para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Zoila is married and has two children. Because she needed to earn income, she learned how to make pupusas. She works in this business from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and she hasn't had problems running it.

She will buy cabbage, pork rinds, cheese, cooking oil, and corn to have her basic materials ready. This will enable her to increase production, make more income, better attend to her customers, pay off her debt, and attract new customers.

She wants to have a more stable business, improve her location, keep paying household expenses, and have an estate that will provide her daughter with a better future.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, pork rinds, cheese, cooking oil, and corn.

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: Hamda was born in 1967. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband and their four children. Her husband is a driver. Hamda has been selling clothes for the past year. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. She considered her work a good source of income to support her husband in covering their children's needs. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes to sell

loans.name: Dillip

texts.en:
Dillip is 31 years old, a differently-able man living with his wife and a son aged 6 years in a small village of Odisha, India.He is engaged in the activity of weaving handkerchiefs, and his wife helps him with the weaving. The financial condition of his family is not good because he does not have enough raw materials for weaving so he earns very little. He has been engaged in this activity for the  last ten years. He brings raw materials like cotton, thread and colors from a dealer and gives back the finished goods to him and in return he gets only the labor cost, which is very little.

He has a plan to bring raw material directly from the market and sell the finished product in the market, so it will increase his income. He has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs. He has a dream that his son would study in a good school and wants to save some money for his family’s future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs.

loans.name: Kamal Lochan

texts.en:
Kamal Lochan is 23 years old, a differently-able man living with his parents and two siblings in a small village of Odisha, India. He is the oldest among his siblings. He is engaged in the activity of making tea and selling it. From this activity he earns 3000 INR per month. He started his business two years ago to help his father. His father is a farmer engaged in the activity of paddy cultivation. Kamal wants to expand his business by adding more grocery items in his tea shop so he can earn more money to help his father with monthly family expenses and his siblings' education.

Kamal Lochan has requested a loan amount of 25,000 INR to pay for purchasing a refrigerator, sugar, cold drinks, biscuits and reconstruction of shop infrastructure. He wants to save some money for his future and also wants to educate his siblings.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a refrigerator, sugar, cold drinks, biscuits and reconstruction of shop infrastructure.

loans.name: Gulnur

texts.ru: Гулнур 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Супруг Амантур работает отвественным секретарем в сельской управе. У Гулнур - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулнур занимается животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнур, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коровы, 1 лошадь, 35 овец. Скот содержат дома, где имеют все условия для содержания скота, а в летнее время отгоняют на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулнур обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Gulnur is 44 years old. She and her husband are raising two children.   Her husband, Amantur, works as an executive secretary for the village council.  Gulnur herself is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business 21 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Gulnur's hard labor, her farming business now comprises seven dairy cows, one horse and 35 sheep.  She keeps her livestock at home, where she has everything she needs to keep farm animals, and in the summer she sends them to graze in the pastures.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  

In order to further develop her activity, Gulnur has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy more sheep and increase her livestock headcount.  She plans to re-invest the profits from her loan into her business, in order to further increase her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to continue to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris nació en la ciudad de Cusco pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). Ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella es técnica en enfermería y en sus horas libre se dedica a la elaboración de panes y pasteles. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de harina para seguir elaborando panes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Doris was born in the city of Cusco, but she lives in Salvación, which is in Manu district, Manu province, Madre de Dios department, Peru. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She is a nursing technician and in her free time, she makes bread and pastries. She has worked in this business for several years and it is going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Doris belongs to the "Las Palmeras del Manu" communal bank. She is currently requesting a loan to buy sacks of flour so she can keep making bread. She values and is grateful for the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Akobir

texts.ru: Акобир спокойный и честный молодой человек. Он родился в 1985 года в сельской местности. Акобир родился в бедной семье. Его родители были простыми фермерами. Акобир не смог получить высшее образование. Он не имеет постоянное место работы в Таджикистане, поэтому он каждый год ездит в Российскую Федерацию в целях найти работу. Ему очень тяжело находится далеко от своих родителей, жены и 3 детей. Его дети маленькие, а жена нигде не работает и занимается воспитанием детей. Акобир всегда старается для благо своей семьи. Он недавно приехал на родину. Акобир хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, песок и т.п. для ремонта дома. Акобир и его семья ждут вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Akobir is an honest and even-tempered young man.  He was born in 1985 to a poor family in a village.  His parents were simple farmers and Akobir couldn't get a higher education.  He doesn't have steady work in Tajikistan, which is why he goes to the Russian Federation every year to find work.  It is very difficult for him to be located so far from his parents, wife and three children.  His children are small and his wife has nowhere to work, as she takes care of the children.  Akobir always strives for the betterment of his family.  He returned home not long ago and he wants to make repairs on his house, but he doesn't have the money.  He is asking for a loan to buy building materials like cement, wood, sand, etc. to repair his home.  Akobir and his family await your kindness and charity.

loans.use: To buy building materials like soil, cement, wood to make repairs on his house

loans.name: 08-03-12-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverage. She is requesting a loan to purchase drinks to sell. Tuyết is 38 years old and she is married with two children. Tuyết is the group leader of the 08-03-12-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents

In 2012, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyết has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase drinks to resell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa has been selling woven nipa leaves for six years, earning enough income for a good living. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used to purchase raw materials and was successfully repaid. Marissa has borrowed a new loan to purchase more nipa leaves to weave. She also buys woven nipa from her community and sells it in town in volume. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa leaves to weave

loans.name: Samuel Eugenio

texts.es:
Samuel,  tiene 54 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene 50 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos, uno de ellos les ayuda en el negocio y el otro estudia bachillerato. El se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, el oficio lo aprendió de familia y  lleva diez años de poseerlo, lo realiza todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar pollos, vitaminas y concentrado; este le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener más ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is 54 years old and married. His wife is 50 years old. They have two children: one helps them with the business and the other is in high school. 

Samuel earns a living by raising and fattening chickens, which he learned from his family. He has been doing this every day for 10 years. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase chickens, vitamins, and feed. This will help him increase his inventory and earn more income. He hopes to strengthen his business and offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vitamins, and feed.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura, es una mujer de 38 años de edad, se identifica en la comunidad, por su lucha constante y deseos de superación, tanto personales como de su familia, posee una familia pequeña conformada  por su hijo y su nuera, ambos forman parte del trabajo que periódicamente se realiza en el hogar. La señora Buenaventura posee buenos principios morales y religiosos que le marcan en su comunidad.

La señora Buenaventura se dedica a los oficios domésticos, desde una temprana edad, fue su madre quien le enseño, en la actualidad ella pretende emprender otras actividades que le generen otros ingresos y mantengan el núcleo familiar integrado. 

Necesita el financiamiento, para adquirir un molino de nixtamal, para que tanto su hijo como su nuera puedan ocuparse en una actividad productiva. Además, de generar ingresos llevar un beneficio a la comunidad.

La señora manifiesta que su propósito es luchar, esforzarse por salir bien con el compromiso para dejar  huellas, que sus hijos puedan seguir y también tengan esta alternativa en sus proyectos y necesidades a futuro.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is a 38 year old woman. She is known in the community for her constant struggle and desire to succeed both personally and with her family. 
She has a small family composed of her son and her daughter in law. They both periodically do some of the work done at home. Buenaventura has good moral and religious principles that are known in her community.

 Buenaventura has been engaged in household chores from an early age. Her mother taught her these chores. Now she intends to undertake other activities that generate other sources of income and maintain the integrated family. 

She needs a loan to purchase a corn mill.  With this purchase, her son and daughter in law can engage in a productive activity. In addition, this will generate revenue which will lead to benefiting the community. She states that her intention is to fight and to strive to succeed in order to leave a great impression. Her family can continue and they will also have this alternative for their projects and future needs.

loans.use: purchase a cornmill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Miltón Balmore

texts.es:
Miltón de 27 años de edad, vive con su familia y se dedica a prestar sus servicios de transporte en su moto taxi que posee; ademas, trabaja en la agricultura con su padre y en la ganadería. Miltón se acompaño y tuvo una niña  que tiene la edad de 5 años no estudian, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos de la casa y cuida de la mamá del esposo.

él posee una mototaxi desde hace 4 años, en la cual el trabaja todo los días, tiene otra actividad que es la ganadería, en la venta de la leche.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un torete, ya que ellos vendieron el que tenían.


Los sueño que posee,  es que su hija pueda estudiar y ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia, también mejorara poco a poco la mototaxi para dar mejor servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Miltón, who is 27 years old, lives with his family. He offers transportation services with his motorcycle taxi, which he owns. In addition, he works in agriculture with his father and in livestock raising. He has a partner and a daughter who is 5 years and does not go to school. His wife does the household domestic work and cares for her husband's mother.

He has had a motorcycle taxi for 4 years, and he uses it for work every day. His other activity is livestock raising and selling milk.

The loan that he is applying for is to buy a young bull, since they sold the one they had.

His dreams are that his daughter can go to school and he can offer a better life to his family. He also wants to improve his motorcycle taxi little by little to give better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: Mukaramakhon

texts.ru: Мукарамахон родилась в 1967 года. Она женщина с национальным духом. Мукарамахон уважает все традиции и обычаи таджикского народа. Она замужем и имеет 2 дочерей. Она более 30 лет занимается изготовлением лепешек. Она начала свой бизнес с 2 мешка муки. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес. Мукарамахон является единственной пекарем лепешек в своем районе. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Он продает лепешки. Мукарамахон с полученного дохода выдала замуж свою дочь и отремонтировала свой дом. Она хочет пополнить оборотный капитал и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки муки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mukaramakhon was born in 1967. She is a woman filled with national spirit. Mukaramakhon respects all the traditions and customs of the Tajik people. She is married and has two daughters. She has been making flatbread for more tha thirty years. She started her business with two sacks of flour. Gradually she increased her business. Mukaramakhon is the only flatbread baker in her area. Her husband helps her run the business. He sells the flat bread. Mukaramakhon would like to take profits she earns from the loan to marry off her daughter and renovate her house. She wants to replenish her working capital and so she applied for a loan. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy flour. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy flour

loans.name: 08-03-11-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Thảo is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Thảo operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pork to make cakes to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2012, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thảo is the group leader of the 08-03-11-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pork to make cakes to sell

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the region of Masaka in Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Monday has been working hard to manage his boutique where he sells various clothes. 

To help expand his business, Monday has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for the business and will help Monday to generate greater profits and take care of his children's medical bills. Monday hopes that in the future, he will be able to achieve his goals. 

Monday is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Monday who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат развивает день изо дня свои навыки и умения. Она портниха. Каромат умеет шить красиво и аккуратно национальные платья. Каромат считает, что для одного человека необходимы несколько профессий. Она всегда мечтала стать учительницей. Она для того, чтобы осуществить свою мечту поступила в Педагогический институт. Она учится отлично и параллельно занимается своим бизнесом. Она мечтает после окончания института работать в школе и преподавать младшим классам. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она не замужем и живет с родителями, а ее родители не в состоянии поддержать ее. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Every day Karomat improves her skills. She is a dressmaker. Karomat sews traditional dresses beautifully and precisely. Karomat believes people need to have more than one vocation. She has always dreamed of becoming a teacher. In order to realize her dream, she entered the Pedagogical Institute. She is a good student and runs her business while she studies. After graduation, she dreams of working in a school and teaching the younger grades. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 KGS to pay tuition. She is not married and lives with her parents, and her parents are not able to help her financially. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep to raise

loans.name: 3.19.604.8. Thị Trấn Quán Lào Group

texts.en:
Huệ operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain a refreshment bar selling coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food, etc.

Huệ is 22 years old and is married with two children..
Huệ is the group leader of the 3.19.604.8. thị trấn Quán Lào solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province

This is Huệ first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Huệ has been involved in this business for five years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain a refreshment bar selling coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food, etc.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is from Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with three children.  He was cultivating corn on his farm and earning enough that he was able to provide for his living. In 2011, Joel joined GDMPC. His previous loan that he used to purchase fertilizers was successfully repaid. He earned such good returns from his farm that he expanded by cultivating another corn field. Recently, he requested a new loan to purchase a new variety of seeds and fertilizer. Joel wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 32 years old and lives in Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with five children.
Joel works in the fishing industry, catching and selling fish for a living. He has been doing this for 24 years. He has requested a loan to purchase a fishing net.
Joel is a new member of PMPC, joining in 2013. In the future, Joel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Obaida

texts.en: Obaida is 18 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his four brothers and his parents. His father currently works in the retirement department for the military. Obaida is in his first year studying for a bachelor's degree in finance. He is planning to continue his studies and to find a job in his study field after graduation, earning a good income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 42 years old and widowed, living with her four children at her brother-in-law’s home in Lahore, Pakistan.  
She owns a small canteen in a school where she offers chips, spicy food items, stationery, etc. for the students. She wants to offer burgers and sandwiches as well but she does not have the funds to buy the raw materials.
Rani requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. She will use the loan to buy spicy ingredients, burgers, eggs and bread for making burgers and sandwiches. She belongs to a poor family; her brother-in-law does not fully financially support her because he is responsible for his own family. 
Rani seems very glad and gives thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy food items such as burgers, eggs and bread for the canteen.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is 20 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafarq with his 12 siblings and his parents. Ziad is in his third year of studying Children Teaching.  He is planning to continue his studies and find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Edy Sabino

texts.es:
Edy de 26 años de edad, sus estudios los realizo hasta 9° grado, el motivo por el cual, no pudo seguir estudiando; es por  falta de recurso económico, ya que sus padres eran muy pobres y no tenían lo suficiente para darle los estudios en ese tiempo. Desde entonce el comenzó a trabajar en talleres, en salineras y con su padre en la agricultura, creció y se  caso y hoy en día tiene dos hijos un barón de 5 años y una niña recién nacida.

Edy es una persona muy conocida en la zona donde vive y es trabajador él es albañil y  repara bombas para poso, él es bien versátil en reparar motores.  Esto lo aprendió desde la edad de 18 años de edad. Se traslada a una distancia de 8 km para brindarle el servicio de  repara las bombas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una moto para transportarse y de esa manera poder dar un buen servicio a los clientes. Le mejorara, porque así no tendrá dificultad para los ingresos de dinero para su familia. 
   

Sus sueños es, que crezcan los hijos sin que le falten nada y en el futuro poder seguir trabajando con la fundación campo.
texts.en:
Edy, 26, went to school through ninth grade. He couldn't continue school due to a lack of economic resources because his parents were very poor and didn't have enough money at the time. Since then, he has been working in workshops, salt mines, and farming with his father. He grew up, got married, and now has two children: a boy, 5, and a girl who was recently born.

Edy is well know in the area where he lives. He is hard-working and works in construction and in repairing pump wells. He is also skilled in repairing motors, which he learned when he was 18. He travels 8 km to provide pump repair services.

Edy is requesting this loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation, which will allow him to provide good service to his customers. This will bring improvements and he will not have trouble providing his family with money.

His dream is for his children to grow up and have everything they need, and in the future, keep working with the land established.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Deysi Yamileth

texts.es: Deysi, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes.  Ella estableció su propio negocio para la manutención familiar y lleva 13 años vendiendo productos de la canasta básica familiar en su pulpería, vende granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, pastas, productos de limpieza y productos enlatados, huevos, harina, pan, café, condimentos, refrescos, churros y otros. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para mantener estable este negocio. actualmente solicita otro por 18,000 Lempiras para surtir de mas productos alimenticios para vender, como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, café, pan, churros, refrescos, y otros, con el fin de seguir manteniendo el negocio para mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: Deysi is 36 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in the town of Omoa, Cortes. She established her own business to support her family, and for 13 years she has been selling basic family products in her grocery store. She sells basic grains, sugar, lard, pastas, cleaning products, canned goods, eggs, flour, bread, coffee, condiments, soft drinks, chips, and other items. She has obtained a number of loans to keep this business stable. Now she is applying for another one of 18,000 Lempiras to stock more food products to sell, such as beans, rice, sugar, lard, eggs, coffee, bread, chips, soft drinks, and other items, with the goal of continuing to maintain her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to stock her business with products such as beans, rice, sugar, lard, eggs, coffee, bread, chips, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Bumaira

texts.ru: Бумайре 49 лет, замужем, мать -героиня, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. Семья у Бумайры дружная, супруг во всем поддерживает Бумайру. Все члены семьи вовлечены в бизнес и помогают своей маме по хозяйству. У Бумайры - среднее образование, она очень ответственная женщина. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бумайра занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года  назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивому характеру Бумайры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, а также с целью дать достойное будущее своим детям, Бумайра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бумайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку холодильника.
texts.en: Bumaira is 49 years old, married and a hero-mother who has six children with her husband.  Her family is close and her husband supports her in all her endeavors.  All the members of her family are involved in their business and they help their mother around the farm.  Bumaira has a high school education and she is a very responsible woman.  As the main source of income for her family, she raises livestock, a business that she started 22 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work and perserverance, Bumaira now has three dairy cows and one horse on her farm.  The monthly income on her farm is 4,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, and also with the goal of giving her children a better future, Bumaira has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase the size of her herd and she also plans to save up money to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: M. Aslam

texts.en:
M. Aslam is a 64-year-old married man. He lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan with his wife and six children. He has been in the business of selling milk since childhood. He learned all the techniques for getting milk from his family. This is the only source of income for the family. One of his buffaloes has grown old and is producing very little milk. He delivers milk in the market and door-to-door. For delivery purposes, he uses his bicycle. He loads milk cans on his bicycle and delivers it early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. His monthly net income is too low due to the old buffalo not meeting the household needs.

Therefore, M. Aslam planned to purchase one more buffalo to increase his sales. However, he finds it difficult due to financial constraints. M. Aslam has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to increase sales, but it will also increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is a very hard-working and responsible person. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk.

loans.name: Ivania Azucena

texts.es: Ivania Azucena, mayor de edad casada con cinco hijos, originaria de uno de los  municipios de Chinandega, zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, y las deliciosas rosquillas, Ivania es una microempresaria que se destaca de forma ambulante en el negocio de las compra y ventas de mercadería en general como: Variedades estilos de ropa tanto para niños como adultos, zapatos, prendas, cosméticos entre otros, sus productos los vende de forma contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal, negocio el cual ya son varios años de tenerlo y que le ha permitido salir adelante a ella y a sus hijos, se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy emprendedora con deseos de superación personal, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo como están próximas las navidades sus pedidos han incrementado mas de lo previsto, por lo tanto necesita para comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos entre otros, Ivania agradece mucho la ayuda que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Ivania Azucena is an older adult. She is married and has five children. She is a native of one of the towns of Chinandega, an area dominated by commerce, tourism, and the delicious doughnuts. Ivania is a micro-entrepreneur who works as a street vendor in the business of buying and selling merchandise in general, such as various styles of clothing, for children as well as for adults, shoes, accessories, and cosmetics, among other items. She sells her products to her regular and occasional customers for cash and on credit. She collects weekly and biweekly. She has already had this business for a number of years, and it has allowed her and her children to advance. She is characterized as being a very entrepreneurial woman with the desire for personal achievement. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital, since the Christmas season is near and her orders have increased more than expected. Therefore she needs to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, among other items. Ivania is very grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in general

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 43 years old and lives in Candura, San Juan, Siquijor. In order to help the family, she sells canned goods, noodles, beverages and soft drinks at her sari-sari store in addition to selling rice cakes.  This year, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, beverages and soft drinks.. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 38 years old, married and lives at Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs. 
Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 7,000.00 PHP to purchase additional feed and piglets. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family and supplement the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to maintain more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: 08-01-10-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Hiền has a retail business selling electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase electronics to resell.

Hiền is 29 years old and she is married with one child.
Hiền is the group leader of the 08-01-10-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiền has been involved in this business for 3three years.
The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase electronics to resell.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina manages her piggery to supplement her husband's income from farming. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Martina is educated and it helped improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Her previous loan was used to invest in her business and was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase feed for her pigs. She hopes to gain more returns from her effort and from the capital invested in her piggery. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en: Maysoon was born in 1973. She is a divorced woman who lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Marka. She has a daughter who is a housewife. Maysoon has been working at her own sewing workshop at her house for one year. She started her project when she learned sewing after being employed previously in sewing workshops. Then she bought her own sewing machines and started her own project at her house. Now she wants to buy more sewing machines to be more productive in order to make better profit so that she can support her and her daughter since they are living alone. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines for her workshop

loans.name: Benita Engracia

texts.es: Doña Benita es originaria de la ciudad de San Marcos,  viuda y madre de cuatro hijos  ya independientes. Tiene 58 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace varios años, vendiendo frijoles cocidos y con las ganancias obtenida poco a poco iba comprando golosinas para vender y otros productos. Hoy en día ha logrado mantener su negocio en pie, gracias a sus esfuerzos ofrece una variedad de productos en su pulpería.
